     203             : 
     204             : // EnsureBlockDisplay:
     205             : // Never change display:none or display:contents *ever*, otherwise:
     206             : //  - if the display value (argument) is not a block-type
     207             : //    then we set it to a valid block display value
     208             : //  - For enforcing the floated/positioned element CSS2 rules
     209             : //  - We allow the behavior of "list-item" to be customized.
     210             : //    CSS21 says that position/float do not convert 'list-item' to 'block',
     211             : //    but it explicitly does not define whether 'list-item' should be
     212             : //    converted to block *on the root node*. To allow for flexibility
     213             : //    (so that we don't have to support a list-item root node), this method
     214             : //    lets the caller pick either behavior, using the 'aConvertListItem' arg.
     215             : //    Reference: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visuren.html#dis-pos-flo
     216             : /* static */
     217             : void
     218           1 : nsRuleNode::EnsureBlockDisplay(StyleDisplay& display,
     219             :                                bool aConvertListItem /* = false */)
     220             : {
     221             :   // see if the display value is already a block
     222           1 :   switch (display) {
     223             :   case StyleDisplay::ListItem:
     224           1 :     if (aConvertListItem) {
     225           1 :       display = StyleDisplay::Block;
     226           1 :       break;
     227             :     } // else, fall through to share the 'break' for non-changing display vals
     228             :     MOZ_FALLTHROUGH;
     229             :   case StyleDisplay::None:
     230             :   case StyleDisplay::Contents:
     231             :     // never change display:none or display:contents *ever*
     232             :   case StyleDisplay::Table:
     233             :   case StyleDisplay::Block:
     234             :   case StyleDisplay::Flex:
     235             :   case StyleDisplay::WebkitBox:
     236             :   case StyleDisplay::Grid:
     237             :   case StyleDisplay::FlowRoot:
     238             :     // do not muck with these at all - already blocks
     239             :     // This is equivalent to nsStyleDisplay::IsBlockOutside.  (XXX Maybe we
     240             :     // should just call that?)
     241             :     // This needs to match the check done in
     242             :     // nsCSSFrameConstructor::FindMathMLData for <math>.
     243             :     break;
     244             : 
     245             :   case StyleDisplay::InlineTable:
     246             :     // make inline tables into tables
     247           1 :     display = StyleDisplay::Table;
     248           1 :     break;
     249             : 
     250             :   case StyleDisplay::InlineFlex:
     251             :     // make inline flex containers into flex containers
     252           1 :     display = StyleDisplay::Flex;
     253           1 :     break;
     254             : 
     255             :   case StyleDisplay::WebkitInlineBox:
     256             :     // make -webkit-inline-box containers into -webkit-box containers
     257           0 :     display = StyleDisplay::WebkitBox;
     258           0 :     break;
     259             : 
     260             :   case StyleDisplay::InlineGrid:
     261             :     // make inline grid containers into grid containers
     262           1 :     display = StyleDisplay::Grid;
     263           1 :     break;
     264             : 
     265             :   default:
     266             :     // make it a block
     267           1 :     display = StyleDisplay::Block;
     268             :   }
     269           1 : }
     270             :

     273             : //    then we set it to a valid inline display value

     283           1 :       break;
     284             :     case StyleDisplay::Table:
     285           0 :       display = StyleDisplay::InlineTable;
     286           0 :       break;

     360           1 : static inline nscoord ScaleViewportCoordTrunc(const nsCSSValue& aValue,
     361             :                                               nscoord aViewportSize)
     362             : {
     363             :   // For units (like percentages and viewport units) where authors might
     364             :   // repeatedly use a value and expect some multiple of the value to be
     365             :   // smaller than a container, we need to use floor rather than round.
     366             :   // We need to use division by 100.0 rather than multiplication by 0.1f
     367             :   // to avoid introducing error.
     368           1 :   return NSToCoordTruncClamped(aValue.GetFloatValue() *
     369           1 :                                aViewportSize / 100.0f);
     370             : }

     372             : /* static */
     373             : already_AddRefed<nsFontMetrics>

     412             : 
     413             : 
     414           1 : static nsSize CalcViewportUnitsScale(nsPresContext* aPresContext)
     415             : {
     416             :   // The caller is making use of viewport units, so notify the pres context
     417             :   // that it will need to rebuild the rule tree if the size of the viewport
     418             :   // changes.
     419             :   aPresContext->SetUsesViewportUnits(true);
     420             : 
     421             :   // The default (when we have 'overflow: auto' on the root element, or
     422             :   // trivially for 'overflow: hidden' since we never have scrollbars in that
     423             :   // case) is to define the scale of the viewport units without considering
     424             :   // scrollbars.
     425           1 :   nsSize viewportSize(aPresContext->GetVisibleArea().Size());
     426             : 
     427             :   // Check for 'overflow: scroll' styles on the root scroll frame. If we find
     428             :   // any, the standard requires us to take scrollbars into account.
     429             :   nsIScrollableFrame* scrollFrame =
     430           1 :     aPresContext->PresShell()->GetRootScrollFrameAsScrollable();
     431           1 :   if (scrollFrame) {
     432           1 :     ScrollbarStyles styles(scrollFrame->GetScrollbarStyles());
     433             : 
     434           1 :     if (styles.mHorizontal == NS_STYLE_OVERFLOW_SCROLL ||
     435           1 :         styles.mVertical == NS_STYLE_OVERFLOW_SCROLL) {
     436             :       // Gather scrollbar size information.
     437             :       nsRenderingContext context(
     438           0 :         aPresContext->PresShell()->CreateReferenceRenderingContext());
     439           0 :       nsMargin sizes(scrollFrame->GetDesiredScrollbarSizes(aPresContext, &context));
     440             : 
     441           0 :       if (styles.mHorizontal == NS_STYLE_OVERFLOW_SCROLL) {
     442             :         // 'overflow-x: scroll' means we must consider the horizontal scrollbar,
     443             :         // which affects the scale of viewport height units.
     444           0 :         viewportSize.height -= sizes.TopBottom();
     445             :       }
     446             : 
     447           0 :       if (styles.mVertical == NS_STYLE_OVERFLOW_SCROLL) {
     448             :         // 'overflow-y: scroll' means we must consider the vertical scrollbar,
     449             :         // which affects the scale of viewport width units.
     450           0 :         viewportSize.width -= sizes.LeftRight();
     451             :       }
     452           1 :     }
     453             :   }
     454             : 
     455           1 :   return viewportSize;
     456             : }
     457             : 
     458             : // If |aStyleFont| is nullptr, aStyleContext->StyleFont() is used.
     459             : //
     460             : // In case that |aValue| is rem unit, if |aStyleContext| is null, callers must
     461             : // specify a valid |aStyleFont| and |aUseProvidedRootEmSize| must be true so
     462             : // that we can get the length from |aStyleFont|.
     463           1 : static nscoord CalcLengthWith(const nsCSSValue& aValue,
     464             :                               nscoord aFontSize,
     465             :                               const nsStyleFont* aStyleFont,
     466             :                               nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
     467             :                               nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     468             :                               bool aUseProvidedRootEmSize,
     469             :                               // aUseUserFontSet should always be true
     470             :                               // except when called from
     471             :                               // CalcLengthWithInitialFont.
     472             :                               bool aUseUserFontSet,
     473             :                               RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
     474             : {
     475             :   NS_ASSERTION(aValue.IsLengthUnit() || aValue.IsCalcUnit(),
     476             :                "not a length or calc unit");
     477             :   NS_ASSERTION(aStyleFont || aStyleContext,
     478             :                "Must have style data");
     479             :   NS_ASSERTION(aStyleContext || aUseProvidedRootEmSize,
     480             :                "Must have style context or specify aUseProvidedRootEmSize");
     481             :   NS_ASSERTION(aPresContext, "Must have prescontext");
     482             : 
     483           1 :   if (aValue.IsFixedLengthUnit()) {
     484           1 :     return aValue.GetFixedLength(aPresContext);
     485             :   }
     486           1 :   if (aValue.IsPixelLengthUnit()) {
     487           1 :     return aValue.GetPixelLength();
     488             :   }
     489           1 :   if (aValue.IsCalcUnit()) {
     490             :     // For properties for which lengths are the *only* units accepted in
     491             :     // calc(), we can handle calc() here and just compute a final
     492             :     // result.  We ensure that we don't get to this code for other
     493             :     // properties by not calling CalcLength in those cases:  SetCoord
     494             :     // only calls CalcLength for a calc when it is appropriate to do so.
     495             :     CalcLengthCalcOps ops(aFontSize, aStyleFont,
     496             :                           aStyleContext, aPresContext,
     497             :                           aUseProvidedRootEmSize, aUseUserFontSet,
     498           1 :                           aConditions);
     499           1 :     return css::ComputeCalc(aValue, ops);
     500             :   }
     501           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
     502             :     // nsPresContext::SetVisibleArea and
     503             :     // nsPresContext::MediaFeatureValuesChanged handle dynamic changes
     504             :     // of the basis for viewport units by rebuilding the rule tree and
     505             :     // style context tree.  Not caching them in the rule tree wouldn't
     506             :     // be sufficient to handle these changes because we also need a way
     507             :     // to get rid of cached values in the style context tree without any
     508             :     // changes in specified style.  We can either do this by not caching
     509             :     // in the rule tree and then throwing away the style context tree
     510             :     // for dynamic viewport size changes, or by allowing caching in the
     511             :     // rule tree and using the existing rebuild style data path that
     512             :     // throws away the style context and the rule tree.
     513             :     // Thus we do cache viewport units in the rule tree.  This allows us
     514             :     // to benefit from the performance advantages of the rule tree
     515             :     // (e.g., faster dynamic changes on other things, like transforms)
     516             :     // and allows us not to need an additional code path, in exchange
     517             :     // for an increased cost to dynamic changes to the viewport size
     518             :     // when viewport units are in use.
     519             :     case eCSSUnit_ViewportWidth: {
     520           1 :       nscoord viewportWidth = CalcViewportUnitsScale(aPresContext).width;
     521           1 :       return ScaleViewportCoordTrunc(aValue, viewportWidth);
     522             :     }
     523             :     case eCSSUnit_ViewportHeight: {
     524           1 :       nscoord viewportHeight = CalcViewportUnitsScale(aPresContext).height;
     525           1 :       return ScaleViewportCoordTrunc(aValue, viewportHeight);
     526             :     }
     527             :     case eCSSUnit_ViewportMin: {
     528           1 :       nsSize vuScale(CalcViewportUnitsScale(aPresContext));
     529           1 :       nscoord viewportMin = min(vuScale.width, vuScale.height);
     530           1 :       return ScaleViewportCoordTrunc(aValue, viewportMin);
     531             :     }
     532             :     case eCSSUnit_ViewportMax: {
     533           1 :       nsSize vuScale(CalcViewportUnitsScale(aPresContext));
     534           1 :       nscoord viewportMax = max(vuScale.width, vuScale.height);
     535           1 :       return ScaleViewportCoordTrunc(aValue, viewportMax);
     536             :     }
     537             :     // While we could deal with 'rem' units correctly by simply not
     538             :     // caching any data that uses them in the rule tree, it's valuable
     539             :     // to store them in the rule tree (for faster dynamic changes of
     540             :     // other things).  And since the font size of the root element
     541             :     // changes rarely, we instead handle dynamic changes to the root
     542             :     // element's font size by rebuilding all style data in
     543             :     // nsCSSFrameConstructor::RestyleElement.
     544             :     case eCSSUnit_RootEM: {
     545             :       aPresContext->SetUsesRootEMUnits(true);
     546             :       nscoord rootFontSize;
     547             : 
     548             :       // NOTE: Be very careful with |styleFont|, since we haven't added any
     549             :       // conditions to aConditions or set it to uncacheable yet, so we don't
     550             :       // want to introduce any dependencies on aStyleContext's data here.
     551             :       const nsStyleFont *styleFont =
     552           1 :         aStyleFont ? aStyleFont : aStyleContext->StyleFont();
     553             : 
     554           1 :       if (aUseProvidedRootEmSize) {
     555             :         // We should use the provided aFontSize as the reference length to
     556             :         // scale. This only happens when we are calculating font-size or
     557             :         // an equivalent (scriptminsize or CalcLengthWithInitialFont) on
     558             :         // the root element, in which case aFontSize is already the
     559             :         // value we want.
     560           1 :         if (aFontSize == -1) {
     561             :           // XXX Should this be styleFont->mSize instead to avoid taking
     562             :           // minfontsize prefs into account?
     563           1 :           aFontSize = styleFont->mFont.size;
     564             :         }
     565           1 :         rootFontSize = aFontSize;
     566           1 :       } else if (aStyleContext && !aStyleContext->GetParent()) {
     567             :         // This is the root element (XXX we don't really know this, but
     568             :         // nsRuleNode::SetFont makes the same assumption!), so we should
     569             :         // use StyleFont on this context to get the root element's
     570             :         // font size.
     571           0 :         rootFontSize = styleFont->mFont.size;
     572             :       } else {
     573             :         // This is not the root element or we are calculating something other
     574             :         // than font size, so rem is relative to the root element's font size.
     575             :         // Find the root style context by walking up the style context tree.
     576             :         // NOTE: We should not call ResolveStyleFor() against the root element
     577             :         // to obtain the root style here because it may lead to reentrant call
     578             :         // of nsStyleSet::GetContext().
     579             :         nsStyleContext* rootStyle = aStyleContext;
     580           1 :         while (rootStyle->GetParent()) {
     581             :           rootStyle = rootStyle->GetParent();
     582             :         }
     583           1 :         const nsStyleFont *rootStyleFont = rootStyle->StyleFont();
     584           1 :         rootFontSize = rootStyleFont->mFont.size;
     585             :       }
     586             : 
     587           1 :       return ScaleCoordRound(aValue, float(rootFontSize));
     588             :     }
     589             :     default:
     590             :       // Fall through to the code for units that can't be stored in the
     591             :       // rule tree because they depend on font data.
     592             :       break;
     593             :   }
     594             :   // Common code for units that depend on the element's font data and
     595             :   // thus can't be stored in the rule tree:
     596             :   const nsStyleFont *styleFont =
     597           1 :     aStyleFont ? aStyleFont : aStyleContext->StyleFont();
     598           1 :   if (aFontSize == -1) {
     599             :     // XXX Should this be styleFont->mSize instead to avoid taking minfontsize
     600             :     // prefs into account?
     601           1 :     aFontSize = styleFont->mFont.size;
     602             :   }
     603           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
     604             :     case eCSSUnit_EM: {
     605           1 :       if (aValue.GetFloatValue() == 0.0f) {
     606             :         // Don't call SetFontSizeDependency for '0em'.
     607             :         return 0;
     608             :       }
     609             :       // CSS2.1 specifies that this unit scales to the computed font
     610             :       // size, not the em-width in the font metrics, despite the name.
     611             :       aConditions.SetFontSizeDependency(aFontSize);
     612           1 :       return ScaleCoordRound(aValue, float(aFontSize));
     613             :     }
     614             :     case eCSSUnit_XHeight: {
     615             :       aPresContext->SetUsesExChUnits(true);

     617             :         nsRuleNode::GetMetricsFor(aPresContext, aStyleContext, styleFont,
     618           1 :                                   aFontSize, aUseUserFontSet);
     619             :       aConditions.SetUncacheable();
     620           1 :       return ScaleCoordRound(aValue, float(fm->XHeight()));
     621             :     }
     622             :     case eCSSUnit_Char: {
     623             :       aPresContext->SetUsesExChUnits(true);

     625             :         nsRuleNode::GetMetricsFor(aPresContext, aStyleContext, styleFont,
     626           1 :                                   aFontSize, aUseUserFontSet);

     631             :       aConditions.SetUncacheable();

     634             :     }
     635             :     default:
     636             :       NS_NOTREACHED("unexpected unit");
     637             :       break;
     638             :   }
     639             :   return 0;
     640             : }

     775             : // This is our public API for handling calc() expressions that involve
     776             : // percentages.

     802             : 
     803             : /* Given an enumerated value that represents a box position, converts it to
     804             :  * a float representing the percentage of the box it corresponds to.  For
     805             :  * example, "center" becomes 0.5f.
     806             :  *
     807             :  * @param aEnumValue The enumerated value.
     808             :  * @return The float percent it corresponds to.
     809             :  */
     810             : static float
     811           1 : GetFloatFromBoxPosition(int32_t aEnumValue)
     812             : {
     813           1 :   switch (aEnumValue) {
     814             :   case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_LEFT:
     815             :   case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_TOP:

     818             :   case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_BOTTOM:

     820             :   default:
     821             :     MOZ_FALLTHROUGH_ASSERT("unexpected box position value");
     822             :   case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_CENTER:
     823           1 :     return 0.5f;
     824             :   }
     825             : }
     826             : 
     827             : #define SETCOORD_NORMAL                 0x01   // N
     828             : #define SETCOORD_AUTO                   0x02   // A
     829             : #define SETCOORD_INHERIT                0x04   // H
     830             : #define SETCOORD_PERCENT                0x08   // P
     831             : #define SETCOORD_FACTOR                 0x10   // F
     832             : #define SETCOORD_LENGTH                 0x20   // L
     833             : #define SETCOORD_INTEGER                0x40   // I
     834             : #define SETCOORD_ENUMERATED             0x80   // E
     835             : #define SETCOORD_NONE                   0x100  // O
     836             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_ZERO           0x200
     837             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_AUTO           0x400
     838             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_NONE           0x800
     839             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_NORMAL         0x1000
     840             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_HALF           0x2000
     841             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_HUNDRED_PCT    0x00004000
     842             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_FACTOR_ONE     0x00008000
     843             : #define SETCOORD_INITIAL_FACTOR_ZERO    0x00010000
     844             : #define SETCOORD_CALC_LENGTH_ONLY       0x00020000
     845             : #define SETCOORD_CALC_CLAMP_NONNEGATIVE 0x00040000 // modifier for CALC_LENGTH_ONLY
     846             : #define SETCOORD_STORE_CALC             0x00080000
     847             : #define SETCOORD_BOX_POSITION           0x00100000 // exclusive with _ENUMERATED
     848             : #define SETCOORD_ANGLE                  0x00200000
     849             : #define SETCOORD_UNSET_INHERIT          0x00400000
     850             : #define SETCOORD_UNSET_INITIAL          0x00800000
     851             : 
     852             : #define SETCOORD_LP     (SETCOORD_LENGTH | SETCOORD_PERCENT)
     853             : #define SETCOORD_LH     (SETCOORD_LENGTH | SETCOORD_INHERIT)
     854             : #define SETCOORD_AH     (SETCOORD_AUTO | SETCOORD_INHERIT)
     855             : #define SETCOORD_LAH    (SETCOORD_AUTO | SETCOORD_LENGTH | SETCOORD_INHERIT)
     856             : #define SETCOORD_LPH    (SETCOORD_LP | SETCOORD_INHERIT)
     857             : #define SETCOORD_LPAH   (SETCOORD_LP | SETCOORD_AH)
     858             : #define SETCOORD_LPE    (SETCOORD_LP | SETCOORD_ENUMERATED)

     866             : #define SETCOORD_IA     (SETCOORD_INTEGER | SETCOORD_AUTO)
     867             : #define SETCOORD_LAE    (SETCOORD_LENGTH | SETCOORD_AUTO | SETCOORD_ENUMERATED)
     868             : 
     869             : // changes aCoord iff it returns true
     870           1 : static bool SetCoord(const nsCSSValue& aValue, nsStyleCoord& aCoord,
     871             :                        const nsStyleCoord& aParentCoord,
     872             :                        int32_t aMask, nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
     873             :                        nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     874             :                        RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
     875             : {
     876           1 :   bool result = true;
     877           1 :   if (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null) {
     878             :     result = false;

     881           1 :             aValue.IsLengthUnit()) ||

     884             :     nscoord len = CalcLength(aValue, aStyleContext, aPresContext,
     885           1 :                              aConditions);

     890             :     }

     895           1 :     aCoord.SetPercentValue(aValue.GetPercentValue());
     896             :   }

     906           1 :            (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated)) {
     907           1 :     aCoord.SetPercentValue(GetFloatFromBoxPosition(aValue.GetIntValue()));
     908             :   }
     909           1 :   else if (((aMask & SETCOORD_AUTO) != 0) &&
     910           1 :            (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Auto)) {
     911           1 :     aCoord.SetAutoValue();
     912             :   }
     913           1 :   else if ((((aMask & SETCOORD_INHERIT) != 0) &&
     914           1 :             aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Inherit) ||
     915           1 :            (((aMask & SETCOORD_UNSET_INHERIT) != 0) &&

     917           1 :     aCoord = aParentCoord;  // just inherit value from parent
     918             :     aConditions.SetUncacheable();
     919             :   }

     921           1 :            (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Normal)) {
     922           1 :     aCoord.SetNormalValue();
     923             :   }
     924           1 :   else if (((aMask & SETCOORD_NONE) != 0) &&
     925           1 :            (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_None)) {
     926           1 :     aCoord.SetNoneValue();
     927             :   }
     928           1 :   else if (((aMask & SETCOORD_FACTOR) != 0) &&

     930           1 :     aCoord.SetFactorValue(aValue.GetFloatValue());
     931             :   }

     935           1 :                                 aConditions);
     936             :   }
     937           1 :   else if (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Initial ||
     938           1 :            (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Unset &&
     939           1 :             ((aMask & SETCOORD_UNSET_INITIAL) != 0))) {
     940           1 :     if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_AUTO) != 0) {
     941           1 :       aCoord.SetAutoValue();
     942             :     }
     943           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_ZERO) != 0) {
     944             :       aCoord.SetCoordValue(0);
     945             :     }
     946           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_FACTOR_ZERO) != 0) {
     947             :       aCoord.SetFactorValue(0.0f);
     948             :     }
     949           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_NONE) != 0) {
     950           1 :       aCoord.SetNoneValue();
     951             :     }
     952           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_NORMAL) != 0) {
     953           1 :       aCoord.SetNormalValue();
     954             :     }
     955           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_HALF) != 0) {
     956             :       aCoord.SetPercentValue(0.5f);
     957             :     }
     958           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_HUNDRED_PCT) != 0) {
     959             :       aCoord.SetPercentValue(1.0f);
     960             :     }
     961           1 :     else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_INITIAL_FACTOR_ONE) != 0) {
     962             :       aCoord.SetFactorValue(1.0f);
     963             :     }
     964             :     else {
     965             :       result = false;  // didn't set anything
     966             :     }
     967             :   }
     968           1 :   else if ((aMask & SETCOORD_ANGLE) != 0 &&
     969           1 :            (aValue.IsAngularUnit())) {
     970             :     nsStyleUnit unit;
     971           1 :     switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
     972             :       case eCSSUnit_Degree: unit = eStyleUnit_Degree; break;
     973             :       case eCSSUnit_Grad:   unit = eStyleUnit_Grad; break;
     974             :       case eCSSUnit_Radian: unit = eStyleUnit_Radian; break;

     980             :   }

     982             :     result = false;  // didn't set anything
     983             :   }
     984           1 :   return result;
     985             : }

    1374             :     case eCSSUnit_Image:

    1376           1 :       break;
    1377             :     case eCSSUnit_Function:

    1379           1 :         SetStyleImageToImageRect(aStyleContext, aValue, aResult);
    1380             :       } else {

    1385             :     {

    1387           1 :       SetGradient(aValue, presContext, aStyleContext, *gradient, aConditions);
    1388           1 :       aResult.SetGradientData(gradient);
    1389           1 :       break;
    1390             :     }
    1391             :     case eCSSUnit_Element:
    1392             :     {
    1393           1 :       nsCOMPtr<nsIAtom> atom = NS_Atomize(aValue.GetStringBufferValue());
    1394           1 :       aResult.SetElementId(atom.forget());
    1395             :       break;
    1396             :     }
    1397             :     case eCSSUnit_Initial:
    1398             :     case eCSSUnit_Unset:
    1399             :     case eCSSUnit_None:
    1400             :       break;
    1401             :     case eCSSUnit_URL:
    1402             :     {
    1403             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1404             :       // eCSSUnit_URL is expected only if
    1405             :       // 1. we have eCSSUnit_URL values for if-visited style contexts, which
    1406             :       //    we can safely treat like 'none'.
    1407             :       // 2. aValue is a local-ref URL, e.g. url(#foo).
    1408             :       // 3. aValue is a not a local-ref URL, but it refers to an element in
    1409             :       //    the current document. For example, the url of the current document
    1410             :       //    is "http://foo.html" and aValue is url(http://foo.html#foo).
    1411             :       //
    1412             :       // We skip image download in TryToStartImageLoadOnValue under #2 and #3,
    1413             :       // and that's part of reasons we get eCSSUnit_URL instead of
    1414             :       // eCSSUnit_Image here.
    1415             : 
    1416             :       // Check #2.
    1417             :       bool isLocalRef = aValue.GetURLStructValue()->IsLocalRef();
    1418             : 
    1419             :       // Check #3.
    1420             :       bool isEqualExceptRef = false;
    1421             :       if (!isLocalRef) {
    1422             :         nsIDocument* currentDoc = presContext->Document();
    1423             :         nsIURI* docURI = currentDoc->GetDocumentURI();
    1424             :         nsIURI* imageURI = aValue.GetURLValue();
    1425             :         imageURI->EqualsExceptRef(docURI, &isEqualExceptRef);
    1426             :       }
    1427             : 
    1428             :       MOZ_ASSERT(aStyleContext->IsStyleIfVisited() || isEqualExceptRef ||
    1429             :                  isLocalRef,
    1430             :                  "unexpected unit; maybe nsCSSValue::Image::Image() failed?");
    1431             : #endif
    1432           1 :       aResult.SetURLValue(do_AddRef(aValue.GetURLStructValue()));
    1433           1 :       break;
    1434             :     }
    1435             :     default:
    1436             :       MOZ_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE("Unexpected Unit type.");
    1437             :       break;
    1438             :   }
    1439             : }

    1517             : 
    1518             : 
    1519             : // flags for SetValue - align values with SETCOORD_* constants
    1520             : // where possible
    1521             : 
    1522             : #define SETVAL_INTEGER                0x40   // I
    1523             : #define SETVAL_ENUMERATED             0x80   // E
    1524             : #define SETVAL_UNSET_INHERIT          0x00400000
    1525             : #define SETVAL_UNSET_INITIAL          0x00800000
    1526             : 
    1527             : // no caller cares whether aField was changed or not
    1528             : template<typename FieldT, typename InitialT,
    1529             :          typename AutoT, typename NoneT, typename NormalT, typename SysFontT>
    1530             : static void
    1531           1 : SetValue(const nsCSSValue& aValue, FieldT& aField,
    1532             :          RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions, uint32_t aMask,
    1533             :          FieldT aParentValue,
    1534             :          InitialT aInitialValue,
    1535             :          AutoT aAutoValue,
    1536             :          NoneT aNoneValue,
    1537             :          NormalT aNormalValue,
    1538             :          SysFontT aSystemFontValue)
    1539             : {
    1540             :   typedef SetValueHelper<FieldT> Helper;
    1541             : 
    1542           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
    1543             :   case eCSSUnit_Null:
    1544             :     return;
    1545             : 
    1546             :     // every caller of SetValue provides inherit and initial
    1547             :     // alternatives, so we don't require them to say so in the mask
    1548             :   case eCSSUnit_Inherit:
    1549             :     aConditions.SetUncacheable();
    1550           1 :     aField = aParentValue;
    1551           1 :     return;
    1552             : 
    1553             :   case eCSSUnit_Initial:
    1554           1 :     Helper::SetValue(aField, aInitialValue);
    1555             :     return;
    1556             : 
    1557             :     // every caller provides one or other of these alternatives,
    1558             :     // but they have to say which
    1559             :   case eCSSUnit_Enumerated:
    1560           1 :     if (aMask & SETVAL_ENUMERATED) {
    1561             :       Helper::SetEnumeratedValue(aField, aValue);
    1562             :       return;
    1563             :     }
    1564             :     break;
    1565             : 
    1566             :   case eCSSUnit_Integer:
    1567           1 :     if (aMask & SETVAL_INTEGER) {
    1568             :       Helper::SetIntegerValue(aField, aValue);
    1569             :       return;
    1570             :     }
    1571             :     break;
    1572             : 
    1573             :     // remaining possibilities in descending order of frequency of use
    1574             :   case eCSSUnit_Auto:
    1575           0 :     Helper::SetValue(aField, aAutoValue);
    1576             :     return;
    1577             : 
    1578             :   case eCSSUnit_None:
    1579           1 :     Helper::SetValue(aField, aNoneValue);
    1580             :     return;
    1581             : 
    1582             :   case eCSSUnit_Normal:
    1583           1 :     Helper::SetValue(aField, aNormalValue);
    1584             :     return;
    1585             : 
    1586             :   case eCSSUnit_System_Font:
    1587           1 :     Helper::SetValue(aField, aSystemFontValue);
    1588             :     return;
    1589             : 
    1590             :   case eCSSUnit_Unset:
    1591           1 :     if (aMask & SETVAL_UNSET_INHERIT) {
    1592             :       aConditions.SetUncacheable();
    1593           1 :       aField = aParentValue;
    1594           1 :       return;
    1595             :     }
    1596           1 :     if (aMask & SETVAL_UNSET_INITIAL) {
    1597           1 :       Helper::SetValue(aField, aInitialValue);
    1598             :       return;
    1599             :     }
    1600             :     break;
    1601             : 
    1602             :   default:
    1603             :     break;
    1604             :   }
    1605             : 
    1606             :   NS_NOTREACHED("SetValue: inappropriate unit");
    1607             : }

    1623             : #define SETFCT_UNSET_INHERIT  0x00400000
    1624             : #define SETFCT_UNSET_INITIAL  0x00800000
    1625             :

    1656           1 :     return;
    1657             : 
    1658             :   case eCSSUnit_None:

    1660           1 :       aField = aInitialValue;
    1661           1 :       return;
    1662             :     }
    1663             :     break;

    1677             :   default:
    1678             :     break;
    1679             :   }

    1819           1 : void nsRuleNode::SetUsedDirectly()
    1820             : {
    1821           1 :   mDependentBits |= NS_RULE_NODE_USED_DIRECTLY;
    1822             : 
    1823             :   // Maintain the invariant that any rule node that is used directly has
    1824             :   // all structs that live in the rule tree cached (which
    1825             :   // nsRuleNode::GetStyleData depends on for speed).
    1826           1 :   if (mDependentBits & NS_STYLE_INHERIT_MASK) {
    1827           1 :     for (nsStyleStructID sid = nsStyleStructID(0); sid < nsStyleStructID_Length;
    1828             :          sid = nsStyleStructID(sid + 1)) {
    1829           1 :       uint32_t bit = nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(sid);
    1830           1 :       if (mDependentBits & bit) {
    1831           1 :         nsRuleNode *source = mParent;
    1832           1 :         while ((source->mDependentBits & bit) && !source->IsUsedDirectly()) {
    1833           1 :           source = source->mParent;
    1834             :         }

    1836             :         NS_ASSERTION(data, "unexpected null struct");
    1837           1 :         mStyleData.SetStyleData(sid, mPresContext, data);
    1838             :       }
    1839             :     }

    1843             : void
    1844           1 : nsRuleNode::ConvertChildrenToHash(int32_t aNumKids)
    1845             : {
    1846             :   NS_ASSERTION(!ChildrenAreHashed() && HaveChildren(),
    1847             :                "must have a non-empty list of children");
    1848             :   PLDHashTable *hash = new PLDHashTable(&ChildrenHashOps,
    1849             :                                         sizeof(ChildrenHashEntry),
    1850           1 :                                         aNumKids);
    1851           1 :   for (nsRuleNode* curr = ChildrenList(); curr; curr = curr->mNextSibling) {
    1852           1 :     Key key = curr->GetKey();
    1853             :     // This will never fail because of the initial size we gave the table.
    1854             :     auto entry =
    1855           1 :       static_cast<ChildrenHashEntry*>(hash->Add(&key));
    1856             :     NS_ASSERTION(!entry->mRuleNode, "duplicate entries in list");
    1857           1 :     entry->mRuleNode = curr;
    1858             :   }
    1859           1 :   SetChildrenHash(hash);

    1862             : void
    1863           1 : nsRuleNode::RemoveChild(nsRuleNode* aNode)
    1864             : {
    1865             :   MOZ_ASSERT(HaveChildren());
    1866           1 :   if (ChildrenAreHashed()) {
    1867           1 :     PLDHashTable* children = ChildrenHash();
    1868           1 :     Key key = aNode->GetKey();
    1869             :     MOZ_ASSERT(children->Search(&key));
    1870           1 :     children->Remove(&key);
    1871           1 :     if (children->EntryCount() == 0) {
    1872           1 :       delete children;
    1873           1 :       mChildren.asVoid = nullptr;
    1874             :     }
    1875             :   } else {
    1876             :     // This linear traversal is unfortunate, but we do the same thing when
    1877             :     // adding nodes. The traversal is bounded by kMaxChildrenInList.
    1878           1 :     nsRuleNode** curr = &mChildren.asList;
    1879           1 :     while (*curr != aNode) {
    1880           1 :       curr = &((*curr)->mNextSibling);
    1881             :       MOZ_ASSERT(*curr);
    1882             :     }
    1883           1 :     *curr = (*curr)->mNextSibling;
    1884             : 
    1885             :     // If there was one element in the list, this sets mChildren.asList
    1886             :     // to 0, and HaveChildren() will return false.
    1887             :   }

    1890             : inline void
    1891           1 : nsRuleNode::PropagateNoneBit(uint32_t aBit, nsRuleNode* aHighestNode)

    1899           1 :     curr = curr->mParent;

    1901           1 : }

    1929             : /* static */ void
    1930           0 : nsRuleNode::PropagateGrandancestorBit(nsStyleContext* aContext,
    1931             :                                       nsStyleContext* aContextInheritedFrom)

    1933             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aContext);

    1935             :              aContextInheritedFrom != aContext,
    1936             :              "aContextInheritedFrom must be an ancestor of aContext");

    1939             :        context != aContextInheritedFrom;
    1940             :        context = context->GetParent()) {
    1941           0 :     if (!context) {
    1942             :       MOZ_ASSERT(false, "aContextInheritedFrom must be an ancestor of "
    1943             :                         "aContext's parent");
    1944             :       break;
    1945             :     }
    1946           0 :     context->AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_CHILD_USES_GRANDANCESTOR_STYLE);
    1947             :   }
    1948           0 : }
    1949             : 
    1950             : /*
    1951             :  * The following "Check" functions are used for determining what type of
    1952             :  * sharing can be used for the data on this rule node.  MORE HERE...
    1953             :  */
    1954             : 
    1955             : /*
    1956             :  * a callback function that that can revise the result of
    1957             :  * CheckSpecifiedProperties before finishing; aResult is the current
    1958             :  * result, and it returns the revised one.
    1959             :  */
    1960             : typedef nsRuleNode::RuleDetail
    1961             :   (* CheckCallbackFn)(const nsRuleData* aRuleData,
    1962             :                       nsRuleNode::RuleDetail aResult);
    1963             : 
    1964             : /**
    1965             :  * @param aValue the value being examined
    1966             :  * @param aSpecifiedCount to be incremented by one if the value is specified
    1967             :  * @param aInheritedCount to be incremented by one if the value is set to inherit
    1968             :  * @param aUnsetCount to be incremented by one if the value is set to unset
    1969             :  */
    1970             : inline void
    1971           1 : ExamineCSSValue(const nsCSSValue& aValue,
    1972             :                 uint32_t& aSpecifiedCount,
    1973             :                 uint32_t& aInheritedCount,
    1974             :                 uint32_t& aUnsetCount)
    1975             : {
    1976           1 :   if (aValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null) {
    1977           1 :     ++aSpecifiedCount;
    1978           1 :     if (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Inherit) {
    1979           1 :       ++aInheritedCount;
    1980           1 :     } else if (aValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Unset) {
    1981           1 :       ++aUnsetCount;
    1982             :     }
    1983             :   }
    1984           1 : }
    1985             : 
    1986             : static nsRuleNode::RuleDetail
    1987           1 : CheckFontCallback(const nsRuleData* aRuleData,
    1988             :                   nsRuleNode::RuleDetail aResult)
    1989             : {
    1990             :   // em, ex, percent, 'larger', and 'smaller' values on font-size depend
    1991             :   // on the parent context's font-size
    1992             :   // Likewise, 'lighter' and 'bolder' values of 'font-weight', and 'wider'
    1993             :   // and 'narrower' values of 'font-stretch' depend on the parent.
    1994           1 :   const nsCSSValue& size = *aRuleData->ValueForFontSize();
    1995           1 :   const nsCSSValue& weight = *aRuleData->ValueForFontWeight();
    1996           1 :   if ((size.IsRelativeLengthUnit() && size.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_RootEM) ||
    1997           1 :       size.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Percent ||
    1998           1 :       (size.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
    1999           1 :        (size.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_FONT_SIZE_SMALLER ||
    2000           1 :         size.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_FONT_SIZE_LARGER)) ||
    2001           1 :       aRuleData->ValueForScriptLevel()->GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Integer ||
    2002           1 :       (weight.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
    2003           1 :        (weight.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_FONT_WEIGHT_BOLDER ||
    2004             :         weight.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_FONT_WEIGHT_LIGHTER))) {
    2005             :     NS_ASSERTION(aResult == nsRuleNode::eRulePartialReset ||
    2006             :                  aResult == nsRuleNode::eRuleFullReset ||
    2007             :                  aResult == nsRuleNode::eRulePartialMixed ||
    2008             :                  aResult == nsRuleNode::eRuleFullMixed,
    2009             :                  "we know we already have a reset-counted property");
    2010             :     // Promote reset to mixed since we have something that depends on
    2011             :     // the parent.  But never promote to inherited since that could
    2012             :     // cause inheritance of the exact value.
    2013           1 :     if (aResult == nsRuleNode::eRulePartialReset)
    2014             :       aResult = nsRuleNode::eRulePartialMixed;
    2015           1 :     else if (aResult == nsRuleNode::eRuleFullReset)
    2016           1 :       aResult = nsRuleNode::eRuleFullMixed;
    2017             :   }
    2018             : 
    2019           1 :   return aResult;
    2020             : }
    2021             : 
    2022             : static nsRuleNode::RuleDetail
    2023           1 : CheckColorCallback(const nsRuleData* aRuleData,
    2024             :                    nsRuleNode::RuleDetail aResult)
    2025             : {
    2026             :   // currentColor values for color require inheritance
    2027           1 :   const nsCSSValue* colorValue = aRuleData->ValueForColor();
    2028           1 :   if (colorValue->GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_EnumColor &&
    2029             :       colorValue->GetIntValue() == NS_COLOR_CURRENTCOLOR) {
    2030             :     NS_ASSERTION(aResult == nsRuleNode::eRuleFullReset,
    2031             :                  "we should already be counted as full-reset");
    2032           1 :     aResult = nsRuleNode::eRuleFullInherited;
    2033             :   }
    2034             : 
    2035           1 :   return aResult;
    2036             : }
    2037             :

    2260             : inline nsRuleNode::RuleDetail
    2261           1 : nsRuleNode::CheckSpecifiedProperties(const nsStyleStructID aSID,
    2262             :                                      const nsRuleData* aRuleData)
    2263             : {
    2264             :   // Build a count of the:
    2265           1 :   uint32_t total = 0,      // total number of props in the struct
    2266           1 :            specified = 0,  // number that were specified for this node
    2267           1 :            inherited = 0,  // number that were 'inherit' (and not
    2268             :                            //   eCSSUnit_Inherit) for this node
    2269           1 :            unset = 0;      // number that were 'unset'
    2270             : 
    2271             :   // See comment in nsRuleData.h above mValueOffsets.
    2272             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aRuleData->mValueOffsets[aSID] == 0,
    2273             :              "we assume the value offset is zero instead of adding it");
    2274           1 :   for (nsCSSValue *values = aRuleData->mValueStorage,
    2275           1 :               *values_end = values + nsCSSProps::PropertyCountInStruct(aSID);
    2276             :        values != values_end; ++values) {
    2277           1 :     ++total;
    2278           1 :     ExamineCSSValue(*values, specified, inherited, unset);
    2279             :   }
    2280             : 
    2281           1 :   if (!nsCachedStyleData::IsReset(aSID)) {
    2282             :     // For inherited properties, 'unset' means the same as 'inherit'.
    2283           1 :     inherited += unset;
    2284           1 :     unset = 0;
    2285             :   }
    2286             : 
    2287             : #if 0
    2288             :   printf("CheckSpecifiedProperties: SID=%d total=%d spec=%d inh=%d.\n",
    2289             :          aSID, total, specified, inherited);
    2290             : #endif
    2291             : 
    2292             :   NS_ASSERTION(aSID != eStyleStruct_Font ||
    2293             :                mPresContext->Document()->GetMathMLEnabled() ||
    2294             :                AreAllMathMLPropertiesUndefined(aRuleData),
    2295             :                "MathML style property was defined even though MathML is disabled");
    2296             : 
    2297             :   /*
    2298             :    * Return the most specific information we can: prefer None or Full
    2299             :    * over Partial, and Reset or Inherited over Mixed, since we can
    2300             :    * optimize based on the edge cases and not the in-between cases.
    2301             :    */
    2302             :   nsRuleNode::RuleDetail result;
    2303           1 :   if (inherited == total)
    2304             :     result = eRuleFullInherited;
    2305           1 :   else if (specified == total
    2306             :            // MathML defines 5 properties in Font that will never be set when
    2307             :            // MathML is not in use. Therefore if all but five
    2308             :            // properties have been set, and MathML is not enabled, we can treat
    2309             :            // this as fully specified. Code in nsMathMLElementFactory will
    2310             :            // rebuild the rule tree and style data when MathML is first enabled
    2311             :            // (see nsMathMLElement::BindToTree).
    2312           1 :            || (aSID == eStyleStruct_Font && specified + 5 == total &&
    2313           1 :                !mPresContext->Document()->GetMathMLEnabled())
    2314             :           ) {
    2315           1 :     if (inherited == 0)
    2316             :       result = eRuleFullReset;
    2317             :     else
    2318           1 :       result = eRuleFullMixed;
    2319           1 :   } else if (specified == 0)
    2320             :     result = eRuleNone;
    2321           1 :   else if (specified == inherited)
    2322             :     result = eRulePartialInherited;
    2323           1 :   else if (inherited == 0)
    2324             :     result = eRulePartialReset;
    2325             :   else
    2326           1 :     result = eRulePartialMixed;
    2327             : 
    2328           1 :   CheckCallbackFn cb = gCheckCallbacks[aSID];
    2329           1 :   if (cb) {
    2330           1 :     result = (*cb)(aRuleData, result);
    2331             :   }
    2332             : 
    2333           1 :   return result;
    2334             : }
    2335             : 
    2336             : // If we need to restrict which properties apply to the style context,
    2337             : // return the bit to check in nsCSSProp's flags table.  Otherwise,
    2338             : // return 0.
    2339             : inline uint32_t
    2340           1 : GetPseudoRestriction(nsStyleContext *aContext)
    2341             : {
    2342             :   // This needs to match nsStyleSet::WalkRestrictionRule.

    2346           1 :     if (pseudoType == nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLetter) {
    2347             :       pseudoRestriction = CSS_PROPERTY_APPLIES_TO_FIRST_LETTER;
    2348           1 :     } else if (pseudoType == nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLine) {
    2349             :       pseudoRestriction = CSS_PROPERTY_APPLIES_TO_FIRST_LINE;
    2350           1 :     } else if (pseudoType == nsCSSPseudoElements::placeholder) {
    2351           1 :       pseudoRestriction = CSS_PROPERTY_APPLIES_TO_PLACEHOLDER;
    2352             :     }
    2353             :   }
    2354           1 :   return pseudoRestriction;

    2357             : static void

    2378           1 : AutoCSSValueArray::AutoCSSValueArray(void* aStorage, size_t aCount)

    2397             : 
    2398             : /* static */ bool
    2399           1 : nsRuleNode::ResolveVariableReferences(const nsStyleStructID aSID,
    2400             :                                       nsRuleData* aRuleData,
    2401             :                                       nsStyleContext* aContext)
    2402             : {
    2403             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aSID != eStyleStruct_Variables);
    2404             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aRuleData->mSIDs & nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(aSID));
    2405             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aRuleData->mValueOffsets[aSID] == 0);
    2406             : 
    2407           1 :   nsCSSParser parser;
    2408           1 :   bool anyTokenStreams = false;
    2409             : 
    2410             :   // Look at each property in the nsRuleData for the given style struct.
    2411           1 :   size_t nprops = nsCSSProps::PropertyCountInStruct(aSID);
    2412           1 :   for (nsCSSValue* value = aRuleData->mValueStorage,
    2413           1 :                   *values_end = aRuleData->mValueStorage + nprops;
    2414             :        value != values_end; value++) {
    2415           1 :     if (value->GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_TokenStream) {
    2416             :       continue;
    2417             :     }
    2418             : 
    2419             :     const CSSVariableValues* variables =
    2420           1 :       &aContext->StyleVariables()->mVariables;
    2421           1 :     nsCSSValueTokenStream* tokenStream = value->GetTokenStreamValue();
    2422             : 
    2423             :     MOZ_ASSERT(tokenStream->mLevel != SheetType::Count,
    2424             :                "Token stream should have a defined level");
    2425             : 
    2426           1 :     AutoRestore<SheetType> saveLevel(aRuleData->mLevel);
    2427           1 :     aRuleData->mLevel = tokenStream->mLevel;
    2428             : 
    2429             :     // Note that ParsePropertyWithVariableReferences relies on the fact
    2430             :     // that the nsCSSValue in aRuleData for the property we are re-parsing
    2431             :     // is still the token stream value.  When
    2432             :     // ParsePropertyWithVariableReferences calls
    2433             :     // nsCSSExpandedDataBlock::MapRuleInfoInto, that function will add
    2434             :     // the ImageValue that is created into the token stream object's
    2435             :     // mImageValues table; see the comment above mImageValues for why.
    2436             : 
    2437             :     // XXX Should pass in sheet here (see bug 952338).
    2438             :     parser.ParsePropertyWithVariableReferences(
    2439             :         tokenStream->mPropertyID, tokenStream->mShorthandPropertyID,
    2440             :         tokenStream->mTokenStream, variables, aRuleData,
    2441             :         tokenStream->mSheetURI, tokenStream->mBaseURI,
    2442             :         tokenStream->mSheetPrincipal, nullptr,
    2443           1 :         tokenStream->mLineNumber, tokenStream->mLineOffset);
    2444           1 :     aRuleData->mConditions.SetUncacheable();
    2445           1 :     anyTokenStreams = true;
    2446             :   }
    2447             : 
    2448           1 :   return anyTokenStreams;
    2449             : }
    2450             : 
    2451             : const void*
    2452           1 : nsRuleNode::WalkRuleTree(const nsStyleStructID aSID,
    2453             :                          nsStyleContext* aContext)
    2454             : {
    2455             :   // use placement new[] on the result of alloca() to allocate a
    2456             :   // variable-sized stack array, including execution of constructors,
    2457             :   // and use an RAII class to run the destructors too.
    2458           1 :   size_t nprops = nsCSSProps::PropertyCountInStruct(aSID);
    2459           1 :   void* dataStorage = alloca(nprops * sizeof(nsCSSValue));
    2460           1 :   AutoCSSValueArray dataArray(dataStorage, nprops);
    2461             : 
    2462             :   nsRuleData ruleData(nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(aSID),
    2463           1 :                       dataArray.get(), mPresContext, aContext);
    2464           1 :   ruleData.mValueOffsets[aSID] = 0;
    2465             : 
    2466             :   // We start at the most specific rule in the tree.
    2467           1 :   void* startStruct = nullptr;
    2468             : 
    2469           1 :   nsRuleNode* ruleNode = this;
    2470           1 :   nsRuleNode* highestNode = nullptr; // The highest node in the rule tree
    2471             :                                     // that has the same properties
    2472             :                                     // specified for struct |aSID| as
    2473             :                                     // |this| does.
    2474           1 :   nsRuleNode* rootNode = this; // After the loop below, this will be the
    2475             :                                // highest node that we've walked without
    2476             :                                // finding cached data on the rule tree.
    2477             :                                // If we don't find any cached data, it
    2478             :                                // will be the root.  (XXX misnamed)
    2479           1 :   RuleDetail detail = eRuleNone;
    2480           1 :   uint32_t bit = nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(aSID);
    2481             : 
    2482           1 :   while (ruleNode) {
    2483             :     // See if this rule node has cached the fact that the remaining
    2484             :     // nodes along this path specify no data whatsoever.
    2485           1 :     if (ruleNode->mNoneBits & bit)
    2486             :       break;
    2487             : 
    2488             :     // If the dependent bit is set on a rule node for this struct, that
    2489             :     // means its rule won't have any information to add, so skip it.
    2490             :     // NOTE: If we exit the loop because of the !IsUsedDirectly() check,
    2491             :     // then we're guaranteed to break immediately afterwards due to a
    2492             :     // non-null startStruct.
    2493           1 :     while ((ruleNode->mDependentBits & bit) && !ruleNode->IsUsedDirectly()) {
    2494             :       NS_ASSERTION(ruleNode->mStyleData.GetStyleData(aSID) == nullptr,
    2495             :                    "dependent bit with cached data makes no sense");
    2496             :       // Climb up to the next rule in the tree (a less specific rule).
    2497           1 :       rootNode = ruleNode;
    2498           1 :       ruleNode = ruleNode->mParent;
    2499             :       NS_ASSERTION(!(ruleNode->mNoneBits & bit), "can't have both bits set");
    2500             :     }
    2501             : 
    2502             :     // Check for cached data after the inner loop above -- otherwise
    2503             :     // we'll miss it.
    2504           1 :     startStruct = ruleNode->mStyleData.GetStyleData(aSID);
    2505           1 :     if (startStruct)
    2506             :       break; // We found a rule with fully specified data.  We don't
    2507             :              // need to go up the tree any further, since the remainder
    2508             :              // of this branch has already been computed.
    2509             : 
    2510             :     // Ask the rule to fill in the properties that it specifies.
    2511           1 :     nsIStyleRule *rule = ruleNode->mRule;
    2512           1 :     if (rule) {
    2513           1 :       ruleData.mLevel = ruleNode->GetLevel();
    2514           1 :       ruleData.mIsImportantRule = ruleNode->IsImportantRule();
    2515           1 :       rule->MapRuleInfoInto(&ruleData);
    2516             :     }
    2517             : 
    2518             :     // Now we check to see how many properties have been specified by
    2519             :     // the rules we've examined so far.
    2520           1 :     RuleDetail oldDetail = detail;
    2521           1 :     detail = CheckSpecifiedProperties(aSID, &ruleData);
    2522             : 
    2523           1 :     if (oldDetail == eRuleNone && detail != eRuleNone)
    2524           1 :       highestNode = ruleNode;
    2525             : 
    2526           1 :     if (detail == eRuleFullReset ||
    2527           1 :         detail == eRuleFullMixed ||
    2528             :         detail == eRuleFullInherited)
    2529             :       break; // We don't need to examine any more rules.  All properties
    2530             :              // have been fully specified.
    2531             : 
    2532             :     // Climb up to the next rule in the tree (a less specific rule).
    2533           1 :     rootNode = ruleNode;
    2534           1 :     ruleNode = ruleNode->mParent;
    2535             :   }
    2536             : 
    2537           1 :   bool recomputeDetail = false;
    2538             : 
    2539             :   // If we are computing a style struct other than nsStyleVariables, and
    2540             :   // ruleData has any properties with variable references (nsCSSValues of
    2541             :   // type eCSSUnit_TokenStream), then we need to resolve these.
    2542           1 :   if (aSID != eStyleStruct_Variables) {
    2543             :     // A property's value might have became 'inherit' after resolving
    2544             :     // variable references.  (This happens when an inherited property
    2545             :     // fails to parse its resolved value.)  We need to recompute
    2546             :     // |detail| in case this happened.
    2547           1 :     recomputeDetail = ResolveVariableReferences(aSID, &ruleData, aContext);
    2548             :   }
    2549             : 
    2550             :   // If needed, unset the properties that don't have a flag that allows
    2551             :   // them to be set for this style context.  (For example, only some
    2552             :   // properties apply to :first-line and :first-letter.)
    2553           1 :   uint32_t pseudoRestriction = GetPseudoRestriction(aContext);
    2554           1 :   if (pseudoRestriction) {
    2555           1 :     UnsetPropertiesWithoutFlags(aSID, &ruleData, pseudoRestriction);
    2556             : 
    2557             :     // We need to recompute |detail| based on the restrictions we just applied.
    2558             :     // We can adjust |detail| arbitrarily because of the restriction
    2559             :     // rule added in nsStyleSet::WalkRestrictionRule.
    2560           1 :     recomputeDetail = true;
    2561             :   }
    2562             : 
    2563           1 :   if (recomputeDetail) {
    2564           1 :     detail = CheckSpecifiedProperties(aSID, &ruleData);
    2565             :   }
    2566             : 
    2567             :   NS_ASSERTION(!startStruct || (detail != eRuleFullReset &&
    2568             :                                 detail != eRuleFullMixed &&
    2569             :                                 detail != eRuleFullInherited),
    2570             :                "can't have start struct and be fully specified");
    2571             : 
    2572           1 :   bool isReset = nsCachedStyleData::IsReset(aSID);
    2573           1 :   if (!highestNode)
    2574           1 :     highestNode = rootNode;
    2575             : 
    2576             :   MOZ_ASSERT(!(aSID == eStyleStruct_Variables && startStruct),
    2577             :              "if we start caching Variables structs in the rule tree, then "
    2578             :              "not forcing detail to eRulePartialMixed just below is no "
    2579             :              "longer valid");
    2580             : 
    2581           1 :   if (!ruleData.mConditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies() &&
    2582             :       aSID != eStyleStruct_Variables) {
    2583             :     // Treat as though some data is specified to avoid the optimizations and
    2584             :     // force data computation.
    2585             :     //
    2586             :     // We don't need to do this for Variables structs since we know those are
    2587             :     // never cached in the rule tree, and it avoids wasteful computation of a
    2588             :     // new Variables struct when we have no additional variable declarations,
    2589             :     // which otherwise could happen when there is an AnimValuesStyleRule
    2590             :     // (which calls SetUncacheable for style contexts with pseudo data).
    2591           1 :     detail = eRulePartialMixed;
    2592             :   }
    2593             : 
    2594           1 :   if (detail == eRuleNone && startStruct) {
    2595             :     // We specified absolutely no rule information, but a parent rule in the tree
    2596             :     // specified all the rule information.  We set a bit along the branch from our
    2597             :     // node in the tree to the node that specified the data that tells nodes on that
    2598             :     // branch that they never need to examine their rules for this particular struct type
    2599             :     // ever again.
    2600           1 :     PropagateDependentBit(aSID, ruleNode, startStruct);
    2601             :     // For inherited structs, mark the struct (which will be set on
    2602             :     // the context by our caller) as not being owned by the context.
    2603           1 :     if (!isReset) {
    2604           1 :       aContext->AddStyleBit(nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(aSID));
    2605           1 :     } else if (HasAnimationData()) {
    2606             :       // If we have animation data, the struct should be cached on the style
    2607             :       // context so that we can peek the struct.
    2608             :       // See comment in AnimValuesStyleRule::MapRuleInfoInto.
    2609           1 :       StoreStyleOnContext(aContext, aSID, startStruct);
    2610             :     }
    2611             : 
    2612           1 :     return startStruct;
    2613             :   }
    2614           1 :   if ((!startStruct && !isReset &&
    2615           1 :        (detail == eRuleNone || detail == eRulePartialInherited)) ||
    2616             :       detail == eRuleFullInherited) {
    2617             :     // We specified no non-inherited information and neither did any of
    2618             :     // our parent rules.
    2619             : 
    2620             :     // We set a bit along the branch from the highest node (ruleNode)
    2621             :     // down to our node (this) indicating that no non-inherited data was
    2622             :     // specified.  This bit is guaranteed to be set already on the path
    2623             :     // from the highest node to the root node in the case where
    2624             :     // (detail == eRuleNone), which is the most common case here.
    2625             :     // We must check |!isReset| because the Compute*Data functions for
    2626             :     // reset structs wouldn't handle none bits correctly.
    2627           1 :     if (highestNode != this && !isReset)
    2628           1 :       PropagateNoneBit(bit, highestNode);
    2629             : 
    2630             :     // All information must necessarily be inherited from our parent style context.
    2631             :     // In the absence of any computed data in the rule tree and with
    2632             :     // no rules specified that didn't have values of 'inherit', we should check our parent.
    2633           1 :     nsStyleContext* parentContext = aContext->GetParent();
    2634           1 :     if (isReset) {
    2635             :       /* Reset structs don't inherit from first-line. */
    2636             :       /* See similar code in COMPUTE_START_RESET */
    2637           1 :       while (parentContext &&
    2638           1 :              parentContext->GetPseudo() == nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLine) {
    2639             :         parentContext = parentContext->GetParent();
    2640             :       }
    2641           1 :       if (parentContext && parentContext != aContext->GetParent()) {
    2642           0 :         PropagateGrandancestorBit(aContext, parentContext);
    2643             :       }
    2644             :     }
    2645           1 :     if (parentContext) {
    2646             :       // We have a parent, and so we should just inherit from the parent.
    2647             :       // Set the inherit bits on our context.  These bits tell the style context that
    2648             :       // it never has to go back to the rule tree for data.  Instead the style context tree
    2649             :       // should be walked to find the data.
    2650           1 :       const void* parentStruct = parentContext->StyleData(aSID);
    2651           1 :       aContext->AddStyleBit(bit); // makes const_cast OK.
    2652           1 :       aContext->SetStyle(aSID, const_cast<void*>(parentStruct));
    2653           1 :       if (isReset) {
    2654           1 :         parentContext->AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_HAS_CHILD_THAT_USES_RESET_STYLE);
    2655             :       }
    2656           1 :       return parentStruct;
    2657             :     }
    2658             :     else
    2659             :       // We are the root.  In the case of fonts, the default values just
    2660             :       // come from the pres context.
    2661           1 :       return SetDefaultOnRoot(aSID, aContext);
    2662             :   }
    2663             : 
    2664             :   typedef const void* (nsRuleNode::*ComputeFunc)(void*, const nsRuleData*,
