    2845             : }
    2846             : 
    2847             : /**
    2848             :  * Begin an nsRuleNode::Compute*Data function for an inherited struct.
    2849             :  *
    2850             :  * @param type_ The nsStyle* type this function computes.
    2851             :  * @param data_ Variable (declared here) holding the result of this
    2852             :  *              function.
    2853             :  * @param parentdata_ Variable (declared here) holding the parent style
    2854             :  *                    context's data for this struct.
    2855             :  */
    2856             : #define COMPUTE_START_INHERITED(type_, data_, parentdata_)                    \
    2857             :   NS_ASSERTION(aRuleDetail != eRuleFullInherited,                             \
    2858             :                "should not have bothered calling Compute*Data");              \
    2859             :                                                                               \
    2860             :   nsStyleContext* parentContext = aContext->GetParent();                      \
    2861             :                                                                               \
    2862             :   nsStyle##type_* data_ = nullptr;                                            \
    2863             :   mozilla::Maybe<nsStyle##type_> maybeFakeParentData;                         \
    2864             :   const nsStyle##type_* parentdata_ = nullptr;                                \
    2865             :   RuleNodeCacheConditions conditions = aConditions;                           \
    2866             :                                                                               \
    2867             :   /* If |conditions.Cacheable()| might be true by the time we're done, we */  \
    2868             :   /* can't call parentContext->Style##type_() since it could recur into */    \
    2869             :   /* setting the same struct on the same rule node, causing a leak. */        \
    2870             :   if (aRuleDetail != eRuleFullReset &&                                        \
    2871             :       (!aStartStruct || (aRuleDetail != eRulePartialReset &&                  \
    2872             :                          aRuleDetail != eRuleNone))) {                        \
    2873             :     if (parentContext) {                                                      \
    2874             :       parentdata_ = parentContext->Style##type_();                            \
    2875             :     } else {                                                                  \
    2876             :       maybeFakeParentData.emplace(mPresContext);                              \
    2877             :       parentdata_ = maybeFakeParentData.ptr();                                \
    2878             :     }                                                                         \
    2879             :   }                                                                           \
    2880             :   if (eStyleStruct_##type_ == eStyleStruct_Variables)                         \
    2881             :     /* no need to copy construct an nsStyleVariables, as we will copy */      \
    2882             :     /* inherited variables (and call SetUncacheable()) in */                  \
    2883             :     /* ComputeVariablesData */                                                \
    2884             :     data_ = new (mPresContext) nsStyle##type_(mPresContext);                  \
    2885             :   else if (aStartStruct)                                                      \
    2886             :     /* We only need to compute the delta between this computed data and */    \
    2887             :     /* our computed data. */                                                  \
    2888             :     data_ = new (mPresContext)                                                \
    2889             :             nsStyle##type_(*static_cast<nsStyle##type_*>(aStartStruct));      \
    2890             :   else {                                                                      \
    2891             :     if (aRuleDetail != eRuleFullMixed && aRuleDetail != eRuleFullReset) {     \
    2892             :       /* No question. We will have to inherit. Go ahead and init */           \
    2893             :       /* with inherited vals from parent. */                                  \
    2894             :       conditions.SetUncacheable();                                            \
    2895             :       if (parentdata_)                                                        \
    2896             :         data_ = new (mPresContext) nsStyle##type_(*parentdata_);              \
    2897             :       else                                                                    \
    2898             :         data_ = new (mPresContext) nsStyle##type_(mPresContext);              \
    2899             :     }                                                                         \
    2900             :     else                                                                      \
    2901             :       data_ = new (mPresContext) nsStyle##type_(mPresContext);                \
    2902             :   }                                                                           \
    2903             :                                                                               \
    2904             :   if (!parentdata_)                                                           \
    2905             :     parentdata_ = data_;
    2906             : 
    2907             : /**
    2908             :  * Begin an nsRuleNode::Compute*Data function for a reset struct.
    2909             :  *
    2910             :  * @param type_ The nsStyle* type this function computes.
    2911             :  * @param data_ Variable (declared here) holding the result of this
    2912             :  *              function.
    2913             :  * @param parentdata_ Variable (declared here) holding the parent style
    2914             :  *                    context's data for this struct.
    2915             :  */
    2916             : #define COMPUTE_START_RESET(type_, data_, parentdata_)                        \
    2917             :   NS_ASSERTION(aRuleDetail != eRuleFullInherited,                             \
    2918             :                "should not have bothered calling Compute*Data");              \
    2919             :                                                                               \
    2920             :   nsStyleContext* parentContext = aContext->GetParent();                      \
    2921             :   /* Reset structs don't inherit from first-line */                           \
    2922             :   /* See similar code in WalkRuleTree */                                      \
    2923             :   while (parentContext &&                                                     \
    2924             :          parentContext->GetPseudo() == nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLine) {      \
    2925             :     parentContext = parentContext->GetParent();                               \
    2926             :   }                                                                           \
    2927             :                                                                               \
    2928             :   nsStyle##type_* data_;                                                      \
    2929             :   if (aStartStruct)                                                           \
    2930             :     /* We only need to compute the delta between this computed data and */    \
    2931             :     /* our computed data. */                                                  \
    2932             :     data_ = new (mPresContext)                                                \
    2933             :             nsStyle##type_(*static_cast<nsStyle##type_*>(aStartStruct));      \
    2934             :   else                                                                        \
    2935             :     data_ = new (mPresContext) nsStyle##type_(mPresContext);                  \
    2936             :                                                                               \
    2937             :   /* If |conditions.Cacheable()| might be true by the time we're done, we */  \
    2938             :   /* can't call parentContext->Style##type_() since it could recur into */    \
    2939             :   /* setting the same struct on the same rule node, causing a leak. */        \
    2940             :   mozilla::Maybe<nsStyle##type_> maybeFakeParentData;                         \
    2941             :   const nsStyle##type_* parentdata_ = data_;                                  \
    2942             :   if (aRuleDetail != eRuleFullReset &&                                        \
    2943             :       aRuleDetail != eRulePartialReset &&                                     \
    2944             :       aRuleDetail != eRuleNone) {                                             \
    2945             :     if (parentContext) {                                                      \
    2946             :       parentdata_ = parentContext->Style##type_();                            \
    2947             :     } else {                                                                  \
    2948             :       maybeFakeParentData.emplace(mPresContext);                              \
    2949             :       parentdata_ = maybeFakeParentData.ptr();                                \
    2950             :     }                                                                         \
    2951             :   }                                                                           \
    2952             :   RuleNodeCacheConditions conditions = aConditions;
    2953             : 
    2954             : /**
    2955             :  * End an nsRuleNode::Compute*Data function for an inherited struct.
    2956             :  *
    2957             :  * @param type_ The nsStyle* type this function computes.
    2958             :  * @param data_ Variable holding the result of this function.
    2959             :  */
    2960             : #define COMPUTE_END_INHERITED(type_, data_)                                   \
    2961             :   NS_POSTCONDITION(!conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies() ||              \
    2962             :                    aRuleDetail == eRuleFullReset ||                           \
    2963             :                    (aStartStruct && aRuleDetail == eRulePartialReset),        \
    2964             :                    "conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies() must be false " \
    2965             :                    "for inherited structs unless all properties have been "   \
    2966             :                    "specified with values other than inherit");               \
    2967             :   if (conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies()) {                            \
    2968             :     /* We were fully specified and can therefore be cached right on the */    \
    2969             :     /* rule node. */                                                          \
    2970             :     if (!aHighestNode->mStyleData.mInheritedData) {                           \
    2971             :       aHighestNode->mStyleData.mInheritedData =                               \
    2972             :         new (mPresContext) nsInheritedStyleData;                              \
    2973             :     }                                                                         \
    2974             :     NS_ASSERTION(!aHighestNode->mStyleData.mInheritedData->                   \
    2975             :                    mStyleStructs[eStyleStruct_##type_],                       \
    2976             :                  "Going to leak style data");                                 \
    2977             :     aHighestNode->mStyleData.mInheritedData->                                 \
    2978             :       mStyleStructs[eStyleStruct_##type_] = data_;                            \
    2979             :     /* Propagate the bit down. */                                             \
    2980             :     PropagateDependentBit(eStyleStruct_##type_, aHighestNode, data_);         \
    2981             :     /* Tell the style context that it doesn't own the data */                 \
    2982             :     aContext->AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_INHERIT_BIT(type_));                       \
    2983             :   }                                                                           \
    2984             :   /* For inherited structs, our caller will cache the data on the */          \
    2985             :   /* style context */                                                         \
    2986             :                                                                               \
    2987             :   return data_;
    2988             : 
    2989             : /**
    2990             :  * End an nsRuleNode::Compute*Data function for a reset struct.
    2991             :  *
    2992             :  * @param type_ The nsStyle* type this function computes.
    2993             :  * @param data_ Variable holding the result of this function.
    2994             :  */
    2995             : #define COMPUTE_END_RESET(type_, data_)                                       \
    2996             :   NS_POSTCONDITION(!conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies() ||              \
    2997             :                    aRuleDetail == eRuleNone ||                                \
    2998             :                    aRuleDetail == eRulePartialReset ||                        \
    2999             :                    aRuleDetail == eRuleFullReset,                             \
    3000             :                    "conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies() must be false " \
    3001             :                    "for reset structs if any properties were specified as "   \
    3002             :                    "inherit");                                                \
    3003             :   if (conditions.CacheableWithoutDependencies()) {                            \
    3004             :     /* We were fully specified and can therefore be cached right on the */    \
    3005             :     /* rule node. */                                                          \
    3006             :     if (!aHighestNode->mStyleData.mResetData) {                               \
    3007             :       aHighestNode->mStyleData.mResetData =                                   \
    3008             :         new (mPresContext) nsConditionalResetStyleData;                       \
    3009             :     }                                                                         \
    3010             :     NS_ASSERTION(!aHighestNode->mStyleData.mResetData->                       \
    3011             :                    GetStyleData(eStyleStruct_##type_),                        \
    3012             :                  "Going to leak style data");                                 \
    3013             :     aHighestNode->mStyleData.mResetData->                                     \
    3014             :       SetStyleData(eStyleStruct_##type_, data_);                              \
    3015             :     /* Propagate the bit down. */                                             \
    3016             :     PropagateDependentBit(eStyleStruct_##type_, aHighestNode, data_);         \
    3017             :     if (HasAnimationData()) {                                                 \
    3018             :       /* If we have animation data, the struct should be cached on the */     \
    3019             :       /* style context so that we can peek the struct. */                     \
    3020             :       /* See comment in AnimValuesStyleRule::MapRuleInfoInto. */              \
    3021             :       StoreStyleOnContext(aContext, eStyleStruct_##type_, data_);             \
    3022             :     }                                                                         \
    3023             :   } else if (conditions.Cacheable()) {                                        \
    3024             :     if (!mStyleData.mResetData) {                                             \
    3025             :       mStyleData.mResetData = new (mPresContext) nsConditionalResetStyleData; \
    3026             :     }                                                                         \
    3027             :     mStyleData.mResetData->                                                   \
    3028             :       SetStyleData(eStyleStruct_##type_, mPresContext, data_, conditions);    \
    3029             :     /* Tell the style context that it doesn't own the data */                 \
    3030             :     aContext->AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_INHERIT_BIT(type_));                       \
    3031             :     aContext->SetStyle(eStyleStruct_##type_, data_);                          \
    3032             :   } else {                                                                    \
    3033             :     /* We can't be cached in the rule node.  We have to be put right */       \
    3034             :     /* on the style context. */                                               \
    3035             :     aContext->SetStyle(eStyleStruct_##type_, data_);                          \
    3036             :     if (aContext->GetParent()) {                                              \
    3037             :       /* This is pessimistic; we could be uncacheable because we had a */     \
    3038             :       /* relative font-weight, for example, which does not need to defeat */  \
    3039             :       /* the restyle optimizations in RestyleManager.cpp that look at */      \
    3040             :       /* NS_STYLE_HAS_CHILD_THAT_USES_RESET_STYLE. */                         \
    3041             :       aContext->GetParent()->                                                 \
    3042             :         AddStyleBit(NS_STYLE_HAS_CHILD_THAT_USES_RESET_STYLE);                \
    3043             :     }                                                                         \
    3044             :   }                                                                           \
    3045             :                                                                               \
    3046             :   return data_;
    3047             : 
    3048             : // This function figures out how much scaling should be suppressed to
    3049             : // satisfy scriptminsize. This is our attempt to implement
    3050             : // http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML2/chapter3.html#id.3.3.4.2.2
    3051             : // This is called after mScriptLevel, mScriptMinSize and mScriptSizeMultiplier
    3052             : // have been set in aFont.
    3053             : //
    3054             : // Here are the invariants we enforce:
    3055             : // 1) A decrease in size must not reduce the size below minscriptsize.
    3056             : // 2) An increase in size must not increase the size above the size we would
    3057             : // have if minscriptsize had not been applied anywhere.
    3058             : // 3) The scriptlevel-induced size change must between 1.0 and the parent's
    3059             : // scriptsizemultiplier^(new script level - old script level), as close to the
    3060             : // latter as possible subject to constraints 1 and 2.
    3061             : static nscoord
    3062           1 : ComputeScriptLevelSize(const nsStyleFont* aFont, const nsStyleFont* aParentFont,
    3063             :                        nsPresContext* aPresContext, nscoord* aUnconstrainedSize)
    3064             : {
    3065             :   int32_t scriptLevelChange =
    3066           1 :     aFont->mScriptLevel - aParentFont->mScriptLevel;
    3067           1 :   if (scriptLevelChange == 0) {
    3068           1 :     *aUnconstrainedSize = aParentFont->mScriptUnconstrainedSize;
    3069             :     // Constraint #3 says that we cannot change size, and #1 and #2 are always
    3070             :     // satisfied with no change. It's important this be fast because it covers
    3071             :     // all non-MathML content.
    3072           1 :     return aParentFont->mSize;
    3073             :   }
    3074             : 
    3075             :   // Compute actual value of minScriptSize
    3076           1 :   nscoord minScriptSize = aParentFont->mScriptMinSize;
    3077           1 :   if (aFont->mAllowZoom) {
    3078           1 :     minScriptSize = nsStyleFont::ZoomText(aPresContext, minScriptSize);
    3079             :   }
    3080             : 
    3081             :   double scriptLevelScale =
    3082           1 :     pow(aParentFont->mScriptSizeMultiplier, scriptLevelChange);
    3083             :   // Compute the size we would have had if minscriptsize had never been
    3084             :   // applied, also prevent overflow (bug 413274)
    3085             :   *aUnconstrainedSize =
    3086           1 :     NSToCoordRoundWithClamp(aParentFont->mScriptUnconstrainedSize*scriptLevelScale);
    3087             :   // Compute the size we could get via scriptlevel change
    3088             :   nscoord scriptLevelSize =
    3089           1 :     NSToCoordRoundWithClamp(aParentFont->mSize*scriptLevelScale);
    3090           1 :   if (scriptLevelScale <= 1.0) {
    3091           1 :     if (aParentFont->mSize <= minScriptSize) {
    3092             :       // We can't decrease the font size at all, so just stick to no change
    3093             :       // (authors are allowed to explicitly set the font size smaller than
    3094             :       // minscriptsize)
    3095             :       return aParentFont->mSize;
    3096             :     }
    3097             :     // We can decrease, so apply constraint #1
    3098           1 :     return std::max(minScriptSize, scriptLevelSize);
    3099             :   } else {
    3100             :     // scriptminsize can only make sizes larger than the unconstrained size
    3101             :     NS_ASSERTION(*aUnconstrainedSize <= scriptLevelSize, "How can this ever happen?");
    3102             :     // Apply constraint #2
    3103           1 :     return std::min(scriptLevelSize, std::max(*aUnconstrainedSize, minScriptSize));
    3104             :   }
    3105             : }
    3106             : 
    3107             : 
    3108             : /* static */ nscoord
    3109           1 : nsRuleNode::CalcFontPointSize(int32_t aHTMLSize, int32_t aBasePointSize,
    3110             :                               nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    3111             :                               nsFontSizeType aFontSizeType)
    3112             : {
    3113             : #define sFontSizeTableMin  9
    3114             : #define sFontSizeTableMax 16
    3115             : 
    3116             : // This table seems to be the one used by MacIE5. We hope its adoption in Mozilla
    3117             : // and eventually in WinIE5.5 will help to establish a standard rendering across
    3118             : // platforms and browsers. For now, it is used only in Strict mode. More can be read
    3119             : // in the document written by Todd Farhner at:
    3120             : // http://style.verso.com/font_size_intervals/altintervals.html
    3121             : //
    3122             :   static int32_t sStrictFontSizeTable[sFontSizeTableMax - sFontSizeTableMin + 1][8] =
    3123             :   {
    3124             :       { 9,    9,     9,     9,    11,    14,    18,    27},
    3125             :       { 9,    9,     9,    10,    12,    15,    20,    30},
    3126             :       { 9,    9,    10,    11,    13,    17,    22,    33},
    3127             :       { 9,    9,    10,    12,    14,    18,    24,    36},
    3128             :       { 9,   10,    12,    13,    16,    20,    26,    39},
    3129             :       { 9,   10,    12,    14,    17,    21,    28,    42},
    3130             :       { 9,   10,    13,    15,    18,    23,    30,    45},
    3131             :       { 9,   10,    13,    16,    18,    24,    32,    48}
    3132             :   };
    3133             : // HTML       1      2      3      4      5      6      7
    3134             : // CSS  xxs   xs     s      m      l     xl     xxl
    3135             : //                          |
    3136             : //                      user pref
    3137             : //
    3138             : //------------------------------------------------------------
    3139             : //
    3140             : // This table gives us compatibility with WinNav4 for the default fonts only.
    3141             : // In WinNav4, the default fonts were:
    3142             : //
    3143             : //     Times/12pt ==   Times/16px at 96ppi
    3144             : //   Courier/10pt == Courier/13px at 96ppi
    3145             : //
    3146             : // The 2 lines below marked "anchored" have the exact pixel sizes used by
    3147             : // WinNav4 for Times/12pt and Courier/10pt at 96ppi. As you can see, the
    3148             : // HTML size 3 (user pref) for those 2 anchored lines is 13px and 16px.
    3149             : //
    3150             : // All values other than the anchored values were filled in by hand, never
    3151             : // going below 9px, and maintaining a "diagonal" relationship. See for
    3152             : // example the 13s -- they follow a diagonal line through the table.
    3153             : //
    3154             :   static int32_t sQuirksFontSizeTable[sFontSizeTableMax - sFontSizeTableMin + 1][8] =
    3155             :   {
    3156             :       { 9,    9,     9,     9,    11,    14,    18,    28 },
    3157             :       { 9,    9,     9,    10,    12,    15,    20,    31 },
    3158             :       { 9,    9,     9,    11,    13,    17,    22,    34 },
    3159             :       { 9,    9,    10,    12,    14,    18,    24,    37 },
    3160             :       { 9,    9,    10,    13,    16,    20,    26,    40 }, // anchored (13)
    3161             :       { 9,    9,    11,    14,    17,    21,    28,    42 },
    3162             :       { 9,   10,    12,    15,    17,    23,    30,    45 },
    3163             :       { 9,   10,    13,    16,    18,    24,    32,    48 }  // anchored (16)
    3164             :   };
    3165             : // HTML       1      2      3      4      5      6      7
    3166             : // CSS  xxs   xs     s      m      l     xl     xxl
    3167             : //                          |
    3168             : //                      user pref
    3169             : 
    3170             : #if 0
    3171             : //
    3172             : // These are the exact pixel values used by WinIE5 at 96ppi.
    3173             : //
    3174             :       { ?,    8,    11,    12,    13,    16,    21,    32 }, // smallest
    3175             :       { ?,    9,    12,    13,    16,    21,    27,    40 }, // smaller
    3176             :       { ?,   10,    13,    16,    18,    24,    32,    48 }, // medium
    3177             :       { ?,   13,    16,    19,    21,    27,    37,    ?? }, // larger
    3178             :       { ?,   16,    19,    21,    24,    32,    43,    ?? }  // largest
    3179             : //
    3180             : // HTML       1      2      3      4      5      6      7
    3181             : // CSS  ?     ?      ?      ?      ?      ?      ?      ?
    3182             : //
    3183             : // (CSS not tested yet.)
    3184             : //
    3185             : #endif
    3186             : 
    3187             :   static int32_t sFontSizeFactors[8] = { 60,75,89,100,120,150,200,300 };
    3188             : 
    3189             :   static int32_t sCSSColumns[7]  = {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}; // xxs...xxl
    3190             :   static int32_t sHTMLColumns[7] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7}; // 1...7
    3191             : 
    3192             :   double dFontSize;
    3193             : 
    3194           1 :   if (aFontSizeType == eFontSize_HTML) {
    3195           1 :     aHTMLSize--;    // input as 1-7
    3196             :   }
    3197             : 
    3198           1 :   if (aHTMLSize < 0)
    3199             :     aHTMLSize = 0;
    3200           1 :   else if (aHTMLSize > 6)
    3201           0 :     aHTMLSize = 6;
    3202             : 
    3203             :   int32_t* column;
    3204           1 :   switch (aFontSizeType)
    3205             :   {
    3206           1 :     case eFontSize_HTML: column = sHTMLColumns; break;
    3207           1 :     case eFontSize_CSS:  column = sCSSColumns;  break;
    3208             :   }
    3209             : 
    3210             :   // Make special call specifically for fonts (needed PrintPreview)
    3211           1 :   int32_t fontSize = nsPresContext::AppUnitsToIntCSSPixels(aBasePointSize);
    3212             : 
    3213           1 :   if ((fontSize >= sFontSizeTableMin) && (fontSize <= sFontSizeTableMax))
    3214             :   {
    3215           1 :     int32_t row = fontSize - sFontSizeTableMin;
    3216             : 
    3217           1 :     if (aPresContext->CompatibilityMode() == eCompatibility_NavQuirks) {
    3218           1 :       dFontSize = nsPresContext::CSSPixelsToAppUnits(sQuirksFontSizeTable[row][column[aHTMLSize]]);
    3219             :     } else {
    3220           1 :       dFontSize = nsPresContext::CSSPixelsToAppUnits(sStrictFontSizeTable[row][column[aHTMLSize]]);
    3221             :     }
    3222             :   }
    3223             :   else
    3224             :   {
    3225           1 :     int32_t factor = sFontSizeFactors[column[aHTMLSize]];
    3226           1 :     dFontSize = (factor * aBasePointSize) / 100;
    3227             :   }
    3228             : 
    3229             : 
    3230           1 :   if (1.0 < dFontSize) {
    3231           1 :     return (nscoord)dFontSize;
    3232             :   }
    3233             :   return (nscoord)1;
    3234             : }
    3235             : 
    3236             : 
    3237             : //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3238             : //
    3239             : //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3240             : 
    3241             : /* static */ nscoord
    3242           1 : nsRuleNode::FindNextSmallerFontSize(nscoord aFontSize, int32_t aBasePointSize,
    3243             :                                     nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    3244             :                                     nsFontSizeType aFontSizeType)
    3245             : {
    3246             :   int32_t index;
    3247             :   int32_t indexMin;
    3248             :   int32_t indexMax;
    3249             :   float relativePosition;
    3250             :   nscoord smallerSize;
    3251           1 :   nscoord indexFontSize = aFontSize; // XXX initialize to quell a spurious gcc3.2 warning
    3252             :   nscoord smallestIndexFontSize;
    3253             :   nscoord largestIndexFontSize;
    3254             :   nscoord smallerIndexFontSize;
    3255             :   nscoord largerIndexFontSize;
    3256             : 
    3257           1 :   nscoord onePx = nsPresContext::CSSPixelsToAppUnits(1);
    3258             : 
    3259           1 :   if (aFontSizeType == eFontSize_HTML) {
    3260             :     indexMin = 1;
    3261             :     indexMax = 7;
    3262             :   } else {
    3263           1 :     indexMin = 0;
    3264           1 :     indexMax = 6;
    3265             :   }
    3266             : 
    3267           1 :   smallestIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(indexMin, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3268           1 :   largestIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(indexMax, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3269           1 :   if (aFontSize > smallestIndexFontSize) {
    3270           1 :     if (aFontSize < NSToCoordRound(float(largestIndexFontSize) * 1.5)) { // smaller will be in HTML table
    3271             :       // find largest index smaller than current
    3272           1 :       for (index = indexMax; index >= indexMin; index--) {
    3273           1 :         indexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3274           1 :         if (indexFontSize < aFontSize)
    3275             :           break;
    3276             :       }
    3277             :       // set up points beyond table for interpolation purposes
    3278           1 :       if (indexFontSize == smallestIndexFontSize) {
    3279           0 :         smallerIndexFontSize = indexFontSize - onePx;
    3280           0 :         largerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index+1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3281           1 :       } else if (indexFontSize == largestIndexFontSize) {
    3282           0 :         smallerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index-1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3283           0 :         largerIndexFontSize = NSToCoordRound(float(largestIndexFontSize) * 1.5);
    3284             :       } else {
    3285           1 :         smallerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index-1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3286           1 :         largerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index+1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3287             :       }
    3288             :       // compute the relative position of the parent size between the two closest indexed sizes
    3289           1 :       relativePosition = float(aFontSize - indexFontSize) / float(largerIndexFontSize - indexFontSize);
    3290             :       // set the new size to have the same relative position between the next smallest two indexed sizes
    3291           1 :       smallerSize = smallerIndexFontSize + NSToCoordRound(relativePosition * (indexFontSize - smallerIndexFontSize));
    3292             :     }
    3293             :     else {  // larger than HTML table, drop by 33%
    3294           0 :       smallerSize = NSToCoordRound(float(aFontSize) / 1.5);
    3295             :     }
    3296             :   }
    3297             :   else { // smaller than HTML table, drop by 1px
    3298           1 :     smallerSize = std::max(aFontSize - onePx, onePx);
    3299             :   }
    3300           1 :   return smallerSize;
    3301             : }
    3302             : 
    3303             : //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3304             : //
    3305             : //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3306             : 
    3307             : /* static */ nscoord
    3308           1 : nsRuleNode::FindNextLargerFontSize(nscoord aFontSize, int32_t aBasePointSize,
    3309             :                                    nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    3310             :                                    nsFontSizeType aFontSizeType)
    3311             : {
    3312             :   int32_t index;
    3313             :   int32_t indexMin;
    3314             :   int32_t indexMax;
    3315             :   float relativePosition;
    3316             :   nscoord adjustment;
    3317             :   nscoord largerSize;
    3318           1 :   nscoord indexFontSize = aFontSize; // XXX initialize to quell a spurious gcc3.2 warning
    3319             :   nscoord smallestIndexFontSize;
    3320             :   nscoord largestIndexFontSize;
    3321             :   nscoord smallerIndexFontSize;
    3322             :   nscoord largerIndexFontSize;
    3323             : 
    3324           1 :   nscoord onePx = nsPresContext::CSSPixelsToAppUnits(1);
    3325             : 
    3326           1 :   if (aFontSizeType == eFontSize_HTML) {
    3327             :     indexMin = 1;
    3328             :     indexMax = 7;
    3329             :   } else {
    3330           1 :     indexMin = 0;
    3331           1 :     indexMax = 6;
    3332             :   }
    3333             : 
    3334           1 :   smallestIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(indexMin, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3335           1 :   largestIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(indexMax, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3336           1 :   if (aFontSize > (smallestIndexFontSize - onePx)) {
    3337           1 :     if (aFontSize < largestIndexFontSize) { // larger will be in HTML table
    3338             :       // find smallest index larger than current
    3339           1 :       for (index = indexMin; index <= indexMax; index++) {
    3340           1 :         indexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3341           1 :         if (indexFontSize > aFontSize)
    3342             :           break;
    3343             :       }
    3344             :       // set up points beyond table for interpolation purposes
    3345           1 :       if (indexFontSize == smallestIndexFontSize) {
    3346           0 :         smallerIndexFontSize = indexFontSize - onePx;
    3347           0 :         largerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index+1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3348           1 :       } else if (indexFontSize == largestIndexFontSize) {
    3349           0 :         smallerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index-1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3350           0 :         largerIndexFontSize = NSCoordSaturatingMultiply(largestIndexFontSize, 1.5);
    3351             :       } else {
    3352           1 :         smallerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index-1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3353           1 :         largerIndexFontSize = CalcFontPointSize(index+1, aBasePointSize, aPresContext, aFontSizeType);
    3354             :       }
    3355             :       // compute the relative position of the parent size between the two closest indexed sizes
    3356           1 :       relativePosition = float(aFontSize - smallerIndexFontSize) / float(indexFontSize - smallerIndexFontSize);
    3357             :       // set the new size to have the same relative position between the next largest two indexed sizes
    3358           1 :       adjustment = NSCoordSaturatingNonnegativeMultiply(largerIndexFontSize - indexFontSize, relativePosition);
    3359           1 :       largerSize = NSCoordSaturatingAdd(indexFontSize, adjustment);
    3360             :     }
    3361             :     else {  // larger than HTML table, increase by 50%
    3362           1 :       largerSize = NSCoordSaturatingMultiply(aFontSize, 1.5);
    3363             :     }
    3364             :   }
    3365             :   else { // smaller than HTML table, increase by 1px
    3366           0 :     largerSize = NSCoordSaturatingAdd(aFontSize, onePx);
    3367             :   }
    3368           1 :   return largerSize;
    3369             : }
    3370             :

    3402             :   {
    3403             :     nscoord size;

    3407             :       // between us and the parent is simply ignored.

    3417           1 :       mConditions.SetUncacheable();

    3743             :   // When we're in the loop in SetGenericFont, we must ensure that we
    3744             :   // always keep aFont->mFlags set to the correct generic.  But we have
    3745             :   // to be careful not to touch it when we're called directly from
    3746             :   // ComputeFontData, because we could have a start struct.

    4196             : static inline void
    4197             : AssertValidFontTag(const nsString& aString)
    4198             : {
    4199             :   // To be valid as a font feature tag, a string MUST be:
    4200             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aString.Length() == 4 &&              // (1) exactly 4 chars long
    4201             :              NS_IsAscii(aString.BeginReading()) && // (2) entirely ASCII
    4202             :              isprint(aString[0]) &&                // (3) all printable chars
    4203             :              isprint(aString[1]) &&
    4204             :              isprint(aString[2]) &&
    4205             :              isprint(aString[3]));
    4206             : }

    4270             : // This should die (bug 380915).
    4271             : //
    4272             : // SetGenericFont:
    4273             : //  - backtrack to an ancestor with the same generic font name (possibly
    4274             : //    up to the root where default values come from the presentation context)

    4276             : /* static */ void
    4277           1 : nsRuleNode::SetGenericFont(nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    4278             :                            nsStyleContext* aContext,
    4279             :                            uint8_t aGenericFontID,
    4280             :                            nsStyleFont* aFont)
    4281             : {
    4282             :   // walk up the contexts until a context with the desired generic font
    4283           1 :   AutoTArray<nsStyleContext*, 8> contextPath;
    4284           1 :   contextPath.AppendElement(aContext);
    4285           1 :   nsStyleContext* higherContext = aContext->GetParent();
    4286           1 :   while (higherContext) {
    4287           1 :     if (higherContext->StyleFont()->mGenericID == aGenericFontID) {
    4288             :       // done walking up the higher contexts
    4289             :       break;
    4290             :     }
    4291           1 :     contextPath.AppendElement(higherContext);
    4292           1 :     higherContext = higherContext->GetParent();
    4293             :   }
    4294             : 
    4295             :   // re-apply the cascading rules, starting from the higher context
    4296             : 
    4297             :   // If we stopped earlier because we reached the root of the style tree,
    4298             :   // we will start with the default generic font from the presentation
    4299             :   // context. Otherwise we start with the higher context.

    4304           1 :     const nsStyleFont* tmpFont = higherContext->StyleFont();
    4305           1 :     parentFont = *tmpFont;
    4306             :   }
    4307           1 :   *aFont = parentFont;
    4308             : 
    4309           1 :   uint32_t fontBit = nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(eStyleStruct_Font);
    4310             : 
    4311             :   // use placement new[] on the result of alloca() to allocate a
    4312             :   // variable-sized stack array, including execution of constructors,
    4313             :   // and use an RAII class to run the destructors too.
    4314           1 :   size_t nprops = nsCSSProps::PropertyCountInStruct(eStyleStruct_Font);
    4315           1 :   void* dataStorage = alloca(nprops * sizeof(nsCSSValue));
    4316             : 
    4317           1 :   for (int32_t i = contextPath.Length() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {

    4322           1 :                         aPresContext, context);

    4327             :     // in |fontData| in ComputeFontData is only for the rules below

    4331           1 :       if (ruleNode->mNoneBits & fontBit)

    4368             : const void*
    4369           1 : nsRuleNode::ComputeFontData(void* aStartStruct,

    4375             : {
    4376           1 :   COMPUTE_START_INHERITED(Font, font, parentFont)
    4377             : 
    4378             :   // NOTE:  The |aRuleDetail| passed in is a little bit conservative due
    4379             :   // to the -moz-system-font property.  We really don't need to consider
    4380             :   // it here in determining whether to cache in the rule tree.  However,
    4381             :   // we do need to consider it in WalkRuleTree when deciding whether to
    4382             :   // walk further up the tree.  So this means that when the font struct
    4383             :   // is fully specified using *longhand* properties (excluding
    4384             :   // -moz-system-font), we won't cache in the rule tree even though we
    4385             :   // could.  However, it's pretty unlikely authors will do that
    4386             :   // (although there is a pretty good chance they'll fully specify it
    4387             :   // using the 'font' shorthand).

    4646             :                "unexpected unit");

    4661             :   }
    4662             : 
    4663             :   result_type
    4664           1 :   MergeMultiplicativeR(nsCSSUnit aCalcFunction,
    4665             :                        result_type aValue1, float aValue2)
    4666             :   {
    4667             :     LengthNumberCalcObj result;

    4669           1 :     if (aCalcFunction == eCSSUnit_Calc_Times_R) {

    5103           1 :   if (coord.isSome()) {
    5104           1 :     text->mWebkitTextStrokeWidth = *coord;
    5105             :   }

    5394             : 
    5395             : // Information about each transition or animation property that is
    5396             : // constant.
    5397             : struct TransitionPropInfo {
    5398             :   nsCSSPropertyID property;
    5399             :   // Location of the count of the property's computed value.
    5400             :   uint32_t nsStyleDisplay::* sdCount;
    5401             : };
    5402             : 
    5403             : // Each property's index in this array must match its index in the
    5404             : // mutable array |transitionPropData| below.
    5405             : static const TransitionPropInfo transitionPropInfo[4] = {
    5406             :   { eCSSProperty_transition_delay,
    5407             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mTransitionDelayCount },
    5408             :   { eCSSProperty_transition_duration,
    5409             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mTransitionDurationCount },
    5410             :   { eCSSProperty_transition_property,
    5411             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mTransitionPropertyCount },
    5412             :   { eCSSProperty_transition_timing_function,
    5413             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mTransitionTimingFunctionCount },
    5414             : };
    5415             : 
    5416             : // Each property's index in this array must match its index in the
    5417             : // mutable array |animationPropData| below.
    5418             : static const TransitionPropInfo animationPropInfo[8] = {
    5419             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_delay,
    5420             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationDelayCount },
    5421             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_duration,
    5422             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationDurationCount },
    5423             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_name,
    5424             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationNameCount },
    5425             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_timing_function,
    5426             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationTimingFunctionCount },
    5427             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_direction,
    5428             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationDirectionCount },
    5429             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_fill_mode,
    5430             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationFillModeCount },
    5431             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_play_state,
    5432             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationPlayStateCount },
    5433             :   { eCSSProperty_animation_iteration_count,
    5434             :     &nsStyleDisplay::mAnimationIterationCountCount },
    5435             : };
    5436             : 
    5437             : // Information about each transition or animation property that changes
    5438             : // during ComputeDisplayData.
    5439             : struct TransitionPropData {
    5440             :   const nsCSSValueList *list;
    5441             :   nsCSSUnit unit;
    5442             :   uint32_t num;
    5443             : };
    5444             : 
    5445             : static uint32_t
    5446           1 : CountTransitionProps(const TransitionPropInfo* aInfo,
    5447             :                      TransitionPropData* aData,
    5448             :                      size_t aLength,
    5449             :                      nsStyleDisplay* aDisplay,
    5450             :                      const nsStyleDisplay* aParentDisplay,
    5451             :                      const nsRuleData* aRuleData,
    5452             :                      RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    5453             : {
    5454             :   // The four transition properties or eight animation properties are
    5455             :   // stored in nsCSSDisplay in a single array for all properties.  The
    5456             :   // number of transitions is equal to the number of items in the
    5457             :   // longest property's value.  Properties that have fewer values than
    5458             :   // the longest are filled in by repeating the list.  However, this
    5459             :   // repetition does not extend the computed value of that particular
    5460             :   // property (for purposes of inheritance, or, in our code, for when
    5461             :   // other properties are overridden by a more specific rule).
    5462             : 
    5463             :   // But actually, since the spec isn't clear yet, we'll fully compute
    5464             :   // all of them (so we can switch easily later), but only care about
    5465             :   // the ones up to the number of items for 'transition-property', per
    5466             :   // http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2009Aug/0109.html .
    5467             : 
    5468             :   // Transitions are difficult to handle correctly because of this.  For
    5469             :   // example, we need to handle scenarios such as:
    5470             :   //  * a more general rule specifies transition-property: a, b, c;
    5471             :   //  * a more specific rule overrides as transition-property: d;
    5472             :   //
    5473             :   // If only the general rule applied, we would fill in the extra
    5474             :   // properties (duration, delay, etc) with initial values to create 3
    5475             :   // fully-specified transitions.  But when the more specific rule
    5476             :   // applies, we should only create a single transition.  In order to do
    5477             :   // this we need to remember which properties were explicitly specified
    5478             :   // and which ones were just filled in with initial values to get a
    5479             :   // fully-specified transition, which we do by remembering the number
    5480             :   // of values for each property.
    5481             : 
    5482           1 :   uint32_t numTransitions = 0;
    5483           1 :   for (size_t i = 0; i < aLength; ++i) {
    5484           1 :     const TransitionPropInfo& info = aInfo[i];
    5485           1 :     TransitionPropData& data = aData[i];
    5486             : 
    5487             :     // cache whether any of the properties are specified as 'inherit' so
    5488             :     // we can use it below
    5489             : 
    5490           1 :     const nsCSSValue& value = *aRuleData->ValueFor(info.property);
    5491           1 :     data.unit = value.GetUnit();
    5492           1 :     data.list = (value.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_List ||
    5493             :                  value.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_ListDep)
    5494           1 :                   ? value.GetListValue() : nullptr;
    5495             : 
    5496             :     // General algorithm to determine how many total transitions we need
    5497             :     // to build.  For each property:
    5498             :     //  - if there is no value specified in for the property in
    5499             :     //    displayData, use the values from the start struct, but only if
    5500             :     //    they were explicitly specified
    5501             :     //  - if there is a value specified for the property in displayData:
    5502             :     //    - if the value is 'inherit', count the number of values for
    5503             :     //      that property are specified by the parent, but only those
    5504             :     //      that were explicitly specified
    5505             :     //    - otherwise, count the number of values specified in displayData
    5506             : 
    5507             : 
    5508             :     // calculate number of elements
    5509           1 :     if (data.unit == eCSSUnit_Inherit) {
    5510           1 :       data.num = aParentDisplay->*(info.sdCount);
    5511             :       aConditions.SetUncacheable();
    5512           1 :     } else if (data.list) {
    5513           1 :       data.num = ListLength(data.list);
    5514             :     } else {
    5515           1 :       data.num = aDisplay->*(info.sdCount);
    5516             :     }
    5517           1 :     if (data.num > numTransitions)
    5518           1 :       numTransitions = data.num;
    5519             :   }
    5520             : 
    5521           1 :   return numTransitions;
    5522             : }
    5523             : 
    5524             : /* static */ void
    5525           1 : nsRuleNode::ComputeTimingFunction(const nsCSSValue& aValue,
    5526             :                                   nsTimingFunction& aResult)
    5527             : {
    5528           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
    5529             :     case eCSSUnit_Enumerated:
    5530           1 :       aResult = nsTimingFunction(aValue.GetIntValue());
    5531           1 :       break;
    5532             :     case eCSSUnit_Cubic_Bezier:
    5533             :       {
    5534           1 :         nsCSSValue::Array* array = aValue.GetArrayValue();
    5535             :         NS_ASSERTION(array && array->Count() == 4,
    5536             :                      "Need 4 control points");
    5537           1 :         aResult = nsTimingFunction(array->Item(0).GetFloatValue(),
    5538             :                                    array->Item(1).GetFloatValue(),
    5539             :                                    array->Item(2).GetFloatValue(),
    5540           1 :                                    array->Item(3).GetFloatValue());
    5541             :       }
    5542           1 :       break;
    5543             :     case eCSSUnit_Steps:
    5544             :       {
    5545           1 :         nsCSSValue::Array* array = aValue.GetArrayValue();
    5546             :         NS_ASSERTION(array && array->Count() == 2,
    5547             :                      "Need 2 items");
    5548             :         NS_ASSERTION(array->Item(0).GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Integer,
    5549             :                      "unexpected first value");
    5550             :         NS_ASSERTION(array->Item(1).GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
    5551             :                      (array->Item(1).GetIntValue() ==
    5552             :                        NS_STYLE_TRANSITION_TIMING_FUNCTION_STEP_START ||
    5553             :                       array->Item(1).GetIntValue() ==
    5554             :                        NS_STYLE_TRANSITION_TIMING_FUNCTION_STEP_END ||
    5555             :                       array->Item(1).GetIntValue() == -1),
    5556             :                      "unexpected second value");

    5558             :           (array->Item(1).GetIntValue() ==

    5560             :               nsTimingFunction::Type::StepStart :
    5561           1 :               nsTimingFunction::Type::StepEnd;
    5562           1 :         aResult = nsTimingFunction(type, array->Item(0).GetIntValue());
    5563             :       }
    5564           1 :       break;
    5565             :     case eCSSUnit_Function:
    5566             :       {
    5567           1 :         nsCSSValue::Array* array = aValue.GetArrayValue();

    5576           1 :       break;
    5577             :     default:
    5578             :       NS_NOTREACHED("Invalid transition property unit");
    5579             :   }
    5580           1 : }
    5581             : 
    5582             : static uint8_t
    5583           1 : GetWillChangeBitFieldFromPropFlags(const nsCSSPropertyID& aProp)
    5584             : {
    5585           1 :   uint8_t willChangeBitField = 0;
    5586           1 :   if (nsCSSProps::PropHasFlags(aProp, CSS_PROPERTY_CREATES_STACKING_CONTEXT)) {
    5587           1 :     willChangeBitField |= NS_STYLE_WILL_CHANGE_STACKING_CONTEXT;
    5588             :   }
    5589             :

    5592             :   }
    5593             : 
    5594           1 :   if (nsCSSProps::PropHasFlags(aProp, CSS_PROPERTY_ABSPOS_CB)) {
    5595           0 :     willChangeBitField |= NS_STYLE_WILL_CHANGE_ABSPOS_CB;
    5596             :   }
    5597             : 
    5598           1 :   return willChangeBitField;
    5599             : }

    6413             :       }
    6414             :     }
    6415             : 
    6416           1 :     if (nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLetter == pseudo) {

    6851             : 
    6852             : template <>
    6853             : struct BackgroundItemComputer<nsCSSValuePairList, nsStyleImageLayers::Repeat>
    6854             : {
    6855           1 :   static void ComputeValue(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    6856             :                            const nsCSSValuePairList* aSpecifiedValue,
    6857             :                            nsStyleImageLayers::Repeat& aComputedValue,
    6858             :                            RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    6859             :   {
    6860             :     NS_ASSERTION(aSpecifiedValue->mXValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated &&
    6861             :                  (aSpecifiedValue->mYValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Enumerated ||
    6862             :                   aSpecifiedValue->mYValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null),
    6863             :                  "Invalid unit");
    6864             : 
    6865           1 :     bool hasContraction = true;
    6866           1 :     uint8_t value = aSpecifiedValue->mXValue.GetIntValue();
    6867           1 :     switch (value) {
    6868             :     case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT_X:
    6869           1 :       aComputedValue.mXRepeat = NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT;
    6870           1 :       aComputedValue.mYRepeat = NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_NO_REPEAT;
    6871             :       break;
    6872             :     case NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT_Y:
    6873           1 :       aComputedValue.mXRepeat = NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_NO_REPEAT;
    6874           1 :       aComputedValue.mYRepeat = NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT;
    6875             :       break;
    6876             :     default:
    6877             :       NS_ASSERTION(value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_NO_REPEAT ||
    6878             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT ||
    6879             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_SPACE ||
    6880             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_ROUND, "Unexpected value");
    6881           1 :       aComputedValue.mXRepeat = value;
    6882           1 :       hasContraction = false;
    6883             :       break;
    6884             :     }
    6885             : 
    6886           1 :     if (hasContraction) {
    6887             :       NS_ASSERTION(aSpecifiedValue->mYValue.GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null,
    6888             :                    "Invalid unit.");
    6889           1 :       return;
    6890             :     }
    6891             : 
    6892           1 :     switch (aSpecifiedValue->mYValue.GetUnit()) {
    6893             :     case eCSSUnit_Null:
    6894           1 :       aComputedValue.mYRepeat = aComputedValue.mXRepeat;
    6895             :       break;
    6896             :     case eCSSUnit_Enumerated:
    6897           1 :       value = aSpecifiedValue->mYValue.GetIntValue();
    6898             :       NS_ASSERTION(value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_NO_REPEAT ||
    6899             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_REPEAT ||
    6900             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_SPACE ||
    6901             :                    value == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_REPEAT_ROUND, "Unexpected value");
    6902           1 :       aComputedValue.mYRepeat = value;
    6903             :       break;
    6904             :     default:
    6905             :       NS_NOTREACHED("Unexpected CSS value");
    6906             :       break;
    6907             :     }
    6908             :   }
    6909             : };
    6910             :

    6939             : /* Helper function for ComputePositionValue.
    6940             :  * This function computes a single PositionCoord from two nsCSSValue objects,
    6941             :  * which represent an edge and an offset from that edge.
    6942             :  */
    6943             : static void
    6944           1 : ComputePositionCoord(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    6945             :                      const nsCSSValue& aEdge,
    6946             :                      const nsCSSValue& aOffset,
    6947             :                      Position::Coord* aResult,
    6948             :                      RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    6949             : {
    6950           1 :   if (eCSSUnit_Percent == aOffset.GetUnit()) {
    6951           1 :     aResult->mLength = 0;
    6952           1 :     aResult->mPercent = aOffset.GetPercentValue();
    6953           1 :     aResult->mHasPercent = true;
    6954           1 :   } else if (aOffset.IsLengthUnit()) {
    6955             :     aResult->mLength = CalcLength(aOffset, aStyleContext,
    6956             :                                   aStyleContext->PresContext(),
    6957           1 :                                   aConditions);
    6958           1 :     aResult->mPercent = 0.0f;
    6959           1 :     aResult->mHasPercent = false;

    6961             :     LengthPercentPairCalcOps ops(aStyleContext,
    6962             :                                  aStyleContext->PresContext(),
    6963           1 :                                  aConditions);

    6965           1 :     aResult->mLength = vals.mLength;
    6966           1 :     aResult->mPercent = vals.mPercent;
    6967           1 :     aResult->mHasPercent = ops.mHasPercent;

    6969           1 :     aResult->mLength = 0;
    6970           1 :     aResult->mPercent = 0.0f;
    6971           1 :     aResult->mHasPercent = false;

    6978             :                                NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_POSITION_RIGHT)) {

    6980             :     } else {
    6981           1 :       sign = 1;
    6982             :     }

    7057             : struct BackgroundSizeAxis {
    7058             :   nsCSSValue nsCSSValuePairList::* specified;
    7059             :   nsStyleImageLayers::Size::Dimension nsStyleImageLayers::Size::* result;

    7062             : 
    7063             : static const BackgroundSizeAxis gBGSizeAxes[] = {
    7064             :   { &nsCSSValuePairList::mXValue,
    7065             :     &nsStyleImageLayers::Size::mWidth,
    7066             :     &nsStyleImageLayers::Size::mWidthType },

    7072             : template <>
    7073             : struct BackgroundItemComputer<nsCSSValuePairList, nsStyleImageLayers::Size>
    7074             : {
    7075           1 :   static void ComputeValue(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    7076             :                            const nsCSSValuePairList* aSpecifiedValue,
    7077             :                            nsStyleImageLayers::Size& aComputedValue,
    7078             :                            RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    7079             :   {
    7080           1 :     nsStyleImageLayers::Size &size = aComputedValue;
    7081           1 :     for (const BackgroundSizeAxis *axis = gBGSizeAxes,
    7082           1 :                         *axis_end = ArrayEnd(gBGSizeAxes);
    7083             :          axis < axis_end; ++axis) {
    7084           1 :       const nsCSSValue &specified = aSpecifiedValue->*(axis->specified);
    7085           1 :       if (eCSSUnit_Auto == specified.GetUnit()) {
    7086           1 :         size.*(axis->type) = nsStyleImageLayers::Size::eAuto;
    7087             :       }
    7088           1 :       else if (eCSSUnit_Enumerated == specified.GetUnit()) {
    7089             :         static_assert(nsStyleImageLayers::Size::eContain ==
    7090             :                       NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_SIZE_CONTAIN &&
    7091             :                       nsStyleImageLayers::Size::eCover ==
    7092             :                       NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_SIZE_COVER,

    7094             :         MOZ_ASSERT(specified.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_SIZE_CONTAIN ||
    7095             :                    specified.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_SIZE_COVER,

    7097           1 :         size.*(axis->type) = specified.GetIntValue();
    7098             :       }
    7099           1 :       else if (eCSSUnit_Null == specified.GetUnit()) {
    7100             :         MOZ_ASSERT(axis == gBGSizeAxes + 1,
    7101             :                    "null allowed only as height value, and only "
    7102             :                    "for contain/cover/initial/inherit");
    7103             : #ifdef DEBUG
    7104             :         {
    7105             :           const nsCSSValue &widthValue = aSpecifiedValue->mXValue;
    7106             :           MOZ_ASSERT(widthValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Inherit &&
    7107             :                      widthValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Initial &&
    7108             :                      widthValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Unset,

    7111             :                      (widthValue.GetIntValue() == NS_STYLE_IMAGELAYER_SIZE_CONTAIN ||

    7113             :                      "null height value not corresponding to allowable "
    7114             :                      "non-null width value");
    7115             :         }
    7116             : #endif
    7117           1 :         size.*(axis->type) = size.mWidthType;
    7118             :       }

    7120           1 :         (size.*(axis->result)).mLength = 0;
    7121           1 :         (size.*(axis->result)).mPercent = specified.GetPercentValue();
    7122           1 :         (size.*(axis->result)).mHasPercent = true;
    7123           1 :         size.*(axis->type) = nsStyleImageLayers::Size::eLengthPercentage;

    7125           1 :       else if (specified.IsLengthUnit()) {

    7133             :         MOZ_ASSERT(specified.IsCalcUnit(), "unexpected unit");

    7135             :                                      aStyleContext->PresContext(),
    7136           1 :                                      aConditions);

    7144             :

    7152             :                "contain/cover apply to both dimensions or to neither");

    7154             : };
    7155             : 
    7156             : template <class ComputedValueItem>
    7157             : static void
    7158           1 : SetImageLayerList(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    7159             :                   const nsCSSValue& aValue,
    7160             :                   nsStyleAutoArray<nsStyleImageLayers::Layer>& aLayers,
    7161             :                   const nsStyleAutoArray<nsStyleImageLayers::Layer>& aParentLayers,
    7162             :                   ComputedValueItem nsStyleImageLayers::Layer::* aResultLocation,
    7163             :                   ComputedValueItem aInitialValue,
    7164             :                   uint32_t aParentItemCount,
    7165             :                   uint32_t& aItemCount,
    7166             :                   uint32_t& aMaxItemCount,
    7167             :                   bool& aRebuild,
    7168             :                   RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    7169             : {
    7170           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
    7171             :   case eCSSUnit_Null:
    7172             :     break;
    7173             : 
    7174             :   case eCSSUnit_Inherit:
    7175           1 :     aRebuild = true;
    7176             :     aConditions.SetUncacheable();
    7177           1 :     aLayers.EnsureLengthAtLeast(aParentItemCount);
    7178           1 :     aItemCount = aParentItemCount;
    7179           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aParentItemCount; ++i) {
    7180           1 :       aLayers[i].*aResultLocation = aParentLayers[i].*aResultLocation;
    7181             :     }
    7182             :     break;
    7183             : 
    7184             :   case eCSSUnit_Initial:
    7185             :   case eCSSUnit_Unset:
    7186           1 :     aRebuild = true;
    7187           1 :     aItemCount = 1;
    7188           1 :     aLayers[0].*aResultLocation = aInitialValue;
    7189           1 :     break;
    7190             : 
    7191             :   case eCSSUnit_List:
    7192             :   case eCSSUnit_ListDep: {
    7193           1 :     aRebuild = true;
    7194           1 :     aItemCount = 0;
    7195           1 :     const nsCSSValueList* item = aValue.GetListValue();
    7196           1 :     do {
    7197             :       NS_ASSERTION(item->mValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null &&
    7198             :                    item->mValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Inherit &&
    7199             :                    item->mValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Initial &&
    7200             :                    item->mValue.GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Unset,
    7201             :                    "unexpected unit");
    7202           1 :       ++aItemCount;
    7203           1 :       aLayers.EnsureLengthAtLeast(aItemCount);
    7204           1 :       BackgroundItemComputer<nsCSSValueList, ComputedValueItem>
    7205             :         ::ComputeValue(aStyleContext, item,
    7206           1 :                        aLayers[aItemCount-1].*aResultLocation,
    7207           1 :                        aConditions);
    7208           1 :       item = item->mNext;
    7209             :     } while (item);
    7210             :     break;
    7211             :   }
    7212             : 
    7213             :   default:
    7214             :     MOZ_ASSERT(false, "unexpected unit");
    7215             :   }
    7216             : 
    7217           1 :   if (aItemCount > aMaxItemCount)
    7218           1 :     aMaxItemCount = aItemCount;
    7219           1 : }
    7220             : 
    7221             : // The same as SetImageLayerList, but for values stored in
    7222             : // layer.mPosition.*aResultLocation instead of layer.*aResultLocation.
    7223             : // This code is duplicated because it would be annoying to make
    7224             : // SetImageLayerList generic enough to handle both cases.
    7225             : static void
    7226           1 : SetImageLayerPositionCoordList(
    7227             :                   nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    7228             :                   const nsCSSValue& aValue,
    7229             :                   nsStyleAutoArray<nsStyleImageLayers::Layer>& aLayers,

    7236             :                   uint32_t& aMaxItemCount,
    7237             :                   bool& aRebuild,

    7243             : 
    7244             :   case eCSSUnit_Inherit:

    7291             : template <class ComputedValueItem>
    7292             : static void
    7293           1 : SetImageLayerPairList(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
    7294             :                       const nsCSSValue& aValue,
    7295             :                       nsStyleAutoArray<nsStyleImageLayers::Layer>& aLayers,

    7309             :

    7327             :   case eCSSUnit_PairList:
    7328             :   case eCSSUnit_PairListDep: {
    7329           1 :     aRebuild = true;

    7738             :     case eCSSUnit_Null:

    7740             :

    7742             :     case eCSSUnit_Unset:

    7744           1 :       border->ClearBorderColors(side);

    7748             :       conditions.SetUncacheable();

    7756             :         }
    7757             :       }
    7758             :       break;
    7759             :     }
    7760             : 
    7761             :     case eCSSUnit_List:

    7763             :       // Some composite border color information has been specified for this
    7764             :       // border side.
    7765           1 :       border->EnsureBorderColors();
    7766           1 :       border->ClearBorderColors(side);
    7767           1 :       const nsCSSValueList* list = value.GetListValue();

    7769           1 :         if (SetColor(list->mValue, unused, mPresContext,
    7770           1 :                      aContext, borderColor, conditions))
    7771           1 :           border->AppendBorderColor(side, borderColor);
    7772             :         else {
    7773             :           NS_NOTREACHED("unexpected item in -moz-border-*-colors list");

    7775           1 :         list = list->mNext;
    7776             :       }
    7777             :       break;
    7778             :     }
    7779             : 
    7780             :     default:
    7781             :       MOZ_ASSERT(false, "unrecognized border color unit");

    7799             :   {
    7800             :     const nsCSSPropertyID* subprops =
    7801           1 :       nsCSSProps::SubpropertyEntryFor(eCSSProperty_border_radius);
    7802           1 :     NS_FOR_CSS_FULL_CORNERS(corner) {
    7803           1 :       int cx = FullToHalfCorner(corner, false);
    7804           1 :       int cy = FullToHalfCorner(corner, true);
    7805           1 :       const nsCSSValue& radius = *aRuleData->ValueFor(subprops[corner]);
    7806           1 :       nsStyleCoord parentX = parentBorder->mBorderRadius.Get(cx);
    7807           1 :       nsStyleCoord parentY = parentBorder->mBorderRadius.Get(cy);
    7808           1 :       nsStyleCoord coordX, coordY;
    7809             : 
    7810           1 :       if (SetPairCoords(radius, coordX, coordY, parentX, parentY,
    7811             :                         SETCOORD_LPH | SETCOORD_INITIAL_ZERO |

    8244             : static void
    8245           1 : SetGridTrackSize(const nsCSSValue& aValue,

    8248             :                  nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,

    8265           1 :                           aStyleContext, aPresContext, aConditions);

    8267             :       NS_ERROR("Expected minmax() or fit-content(), got another function name");
    8268             :     }
    8269             :   } else {

    8283             :                        const nsStyleCoord& aParentValueMax,

    8285             :                        nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    8286             :                        RuleNodeCacheConditions& aConditions)
    8287             : 
    8288             : {
    8289           1 :   switch (aValue.GetUnit()) {
    8290             :   case eCSSUnit_Null:
    8291             :     break;
    8292             : 
    8293             :   case eCSSUnit_Inherit:
    8294             :     aConditions.SetUncacheable();

    8296           1 :     aResultMax = aParentValueMax;
    8297           1 :     break;
    8298             : 
    8299             :   case eCSSUnit_Initial:
    8300             :   case eCSSUnit_Unset:
    8301             :     // The initial value is 'auto',
    8302             :     // which computes to 'minmax(auto, auto)'.
    8303             :     // (Explicitly-specified 'auto' values are handled in SetGridTrackSize.)
    8304           1 :     aResultMin.SetAutoValue();
    8305           1 :     aResultMax.SetAutoValue();
    8306           1 :     break;

    8308             :   default:
    8309             :     SetGridTrackSize(aValue, aResultMin, aResultMax,
    8310           1 :                      aStyleContext, aPresContext, aConditions);
    8311             :   }
    8312           1 : }

    8314             : static void

    8330             : static void
    8331           1 : SetGridTrackList(const nsCSSValue& aValue,

    8344             :     aConditions.SetUncacheable();

    8358           1 :     aResult.mIsAutoFill = false;
    8359           1 :     break;

    8361             :   default:
    8362           1 :     aResult.mLineNameLists.Clear();
    8363           1 :     aResult.mMinTrackSizingFunctions.Clear();
    8364           1 :     aResult.mMaxTrackSizingFunctions.Clear();
    8365           1 :     aResult.mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore.Clear();
    8366           1 :     aResult.mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter.Clear();

    8412             :                      "can only have one <auto-repeat>");

    8416           1 :               aResult.mIsAutoFill = true;
    8417           1 :               break;

    8523             : const void*
    8524           1 : nsRuleNode::ComputePositionData(void* aStartStruct,

    8531           1 :   COMPUTE_START_RESET(Position, pos, parentPos)
    8532             : 
    8533             :   // box offsets: length, percent, calc, auto, inherit

    8535             :     eCSSProperty_top,
    8536             :     eCSSProperty_right,
    8537             :     eCSSProperty_bottom,
    8538             :     eCSSProperty_left

    8546             :                    SETCOORD_UNSET_INITIAL,
    8547           1 :                  aContext, mPresContext, conditions)) {
    8548           1 :       pos->mOffset.Set(side, coord);
    8549             :     }
    8550             :   }
    8551             : 
    8552             :   // We allow the enumerated box size property values -moz-min-content, etc. to
    8553             :   // be specified on both the {,min-,max-}width properties and the
    8554             :   // {,min-,max-}height properties, regardless of the writing mode.  This is
    8555             :   // because the writing mode is not determined until here, at computed value
    8556             :   // time.  Since we do not support layout behavior of these keywords on the
    8557             :   // block-axis properties, we turn them into unset if we find them in
    8558             :   // that case.

    9325             : static void
    9326           1 : SetSVGPaint(const nsCSSValue& aValue, const nsStyleSVGPaint& parentPaint,

   10584             :          i < i_end; ++i) {

   10592             :          i < i_end; ++i) {
