   10594           1 :       values[nValues++] = ruleData.ValueFor(textShadowValues[i]);
   10595             :     }

   10597             : 
   10598           1 :   nsStyleContext* styleContext = aStyleContext;
   10599             : 
   10600             :   // We need to be careful not to count styles covered up by user-important or
   10601             :   // UA-important declarations.  But we do want to catch explicit inherit
   10602             :   // styling in those and check our parent style context to see whether we have
   10603             :   // user styling for those properties.  Note that we don't care here about
   10604             :   // inheritance due to lack of a specified value, since all the properties we
   10605             :   // care about are reset properties.
   10606             :   bool haveExplicitUAInherit;
   10607           1 :   do {
   10608           1 :     haveExplicitUAInherit = false;
   10609           1 :     for (nsRuleNode* ruleNode = styleContext->RuleNode(); ruleNode;
   10610             :          ruleNode = ruleNode->GetParent()) {
   10611           1 :       nsIStyleRule *rule = ruleNode->GetRule();
   10612           1 :       if (rule) {
   10613           1 :         ruleData.mLevel = ruleNode->GetLevel();
   10614           1 :         ruleData.mIsImportantRule = ruleNode->IsImportantRule();
   10615             : 
   10616           1 :         rule->MapRuleInfoInto(&ruleData);
   10617             : 
   10618           1 :         if (ruleData.mLevel == SheetType::Agent ||
   10619             :             ruleData.mLevel == SheetType::User) {
   10620             :           // This is a rule whose effect we want to ignore, so if any of
   10621             :           // the properties we care about were set, set them to the dummy
   10622             :           // value that they'll never otherwise get.
   10623           1 :           for (uint32_t i = 0; i < nValues; ++i) {
   10624           1 :             nsCSSUnit unit = values[i]->GetUnit();
   10625           1 :             if (unit != eCSSUnit_Null &&
   10626           1 :                 unit != eCSSUnit_Dummy &&
   10627             :                 unit != eCSSUnit_DummyInherit) {
   10628           1 :               if (unit == eCSSUnit_Inherit ||
   10629           0 :                   (i >= inheritedOffset && unit == eCSSUnit_Unset)) {
   10630           0 :                 haveExplicitUAInherit = true;
   10631           0 :                 values[i]->SetDummyInheritValue();
   10632             :               } else {
   10633           1 :                 values[i]->SetDummyValue();
   10634             :               }
   10635             :             }
   10636             :           }
   10637             :         } else {
   10638             :           // If any of the values we care about was set by the above rule,
   10639             :           // we have author style.
   10640           1 :           for (uint32_t i = 0; i < nValues; ++i) {
   10641           1 :             if (values[i]->GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null &&
   10642           1 :                 values[i]->GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Dummy && // see above
   10643           1 :                 values[i]->GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_DummyInherit) {
   10644             :               // If author colors are not allowed, only claim to have
   10645             :               // author-specified rules if we're looking at a non-color
   10646             :               // property or if we're looking at the background color and it's
   10647             :               // set to transparent.  Anything else should get set to a dummy
   10648             :               // value instead.
   10649           1 :               if (aAuthorColorsAllowed ||
   10650             :                   !nsCSSProps::PropHasFlags(properties[i],
   10651           1 :                      CSS_PROPERTY_IGNORED_WHEN_COLORS_DISABLED) ||
   10652           1 :                   (properties[i] == eCSSProperty_background_color &&
   10653           1 :                    !values[i]->IsNonTransparentColor())) {
   10654             :                 return true;
   10655             :               }
   10656             : 
   10657           1 :               values[i]->SetDummyValue();
   10658             :             }
   10659             :           }
   10660             :         }
   10661             :       }
   10662             :     }
   10663             : 
   10664           1 :     if (haveExplicitUAInherit) {
   10665             :       // reset all the eCSSUnit_Null values to eCSSUnit_Dummy (since they're
   10666             :       // not styled by the author, or by anyone else), and then reset all the
   10667             :       // eCSSUnit_DummyInherit values to eCSSUnit_Null (so we will be able to
   10668             :       // detect them being styled by the author) and move up to our parent
   10669             :       // style context.
   10670           0 :       for (uint32_t i = 0; i < nValues; ++i)
   10671           0 :         if (values[i]->GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_Null)
   10672           0 :           values[i]->SetDummyValue();
   10673           0 :       for (uint32_t i = 0; i < nValues; ++i)
   10674           0 :         if (values[i]->GetUnit() == eCSSUnit_DummyInherit)
   10675           0 :           values[i]->Reset();
   10676           0 :       styleContext = styleContext->GetParent();
   10677             :     }
   10678           1 :   } while (haveExplicitUAInherit && styleContext);
   10679             : 
   10680           1 :   return false;

   10682             : 
   10683             : /* static */ void
   10684           1 : nsRuleNode::ComputePropertiesOverridingAnimation(
   10685             :                               const nsTArray<nsCSSPropertyID>& aProperties,
   10686             :                               nsStyleContext* aStyleContext,
   10687             :                               nsCSSPropertyIDSet& aPropertiesOverridden)
   10688             : {
   10689             :   /*
   10690             :    * Set up an nsRuleData with all the structs needed for all of the
   10691             :    * properties in aProperties.
   10692             :    */

   10694           1 :   size_t nprops = 0;

   10701           1 :     if (!(structBits & bit)) {
   10702           1 :       structBits |= bit;
   10703           1 :       offsets[sid] = nprops;
   10704           1 :       nprops += nsCSSProps::PropertyCountInStruct(sid);
   10705             :     }

   10710             : 
   10711             :   // We're relying on the use of |aStyleContext| not mutating it!

   10713           1 :                       aStyleContext->PresContext(), aStyleContext);

   10716           1 :     if (structBits & nsCachedStyleData::GetBitForSID(sid)) {
   10717           1 :       ruleData.mValueOffsets[sid] = offsets[sid];
   10718             :     }
   10719             :   }
   10720             : 
   10721             :   /*
   10722             :    * Actually walk up the rule tree until we're someplace less
   10723             :    * specific than animations.
   10724             :    */
   10725           1 :   for (nsRuleNode* ruleNode = aStyleContext->RuleNode(); ruleNode;
   10726             :        ruleNode = ruleNode->GetParent()) {
   10727           1 :     nsIStyleRule *rule = ruleNode->GetRule();
   10728           1 :     if (rule) {
   10729           1 :       ruleData.mLevel = ruleNode->GetLevel();
   10730           1 :       ruleData.mIsImportantRule = ruleNode->IsImportantRule();
   10731             : 
   10732             :       // Transitions are the only non-!important level overriding
   10733             :       // animations in the cascade ordering.  They also don't actually
   10734             :       // override animations, since transitions are suppressed when both
   10735             :       // are present.  And since we might not have called
   10736             :       // UpdateCascadeResults (which updates when they are suppressed
   10737             :       // due to the presence of animations for the same element and
   10738             :       // property) for transitions yet (which will make their
   10739             :       // MapRuleInfoInto skip the properties that are currently
   10740             :       // animating), we should skip them explicitly.
   10741           1 :       if (ruleData.mLevel == SheetType::Transition) {
   10742             :         continue;
   10743             :       }
   10744             : 
   10745           1 :       if (!ruleData.mIsImportantRule) {
   10746             :         // We're now equal to or less than the animation level; stop.
   10747             :         break;
   10748             :       }
   10749             : 
   10750           1 :       rule->MapRuleInfoInto(&ruleData);
   10751             :     }
   10752             :   }
   10753             : 
   10754             :   /*
   10755             :    * Fill in which properties were overridden.
   10756             :    */
   10757           1 :   for (size_t propIdx = 0, propEnd = aProperties.Length();
   10758             :        propIdx < propEnd; ++propIdx) {
   10759           1 :     nsCSSPropertyID prop = aProperties[propIdx];
   10760           1 :     if (ruleData.ValueFor(prop)->GetUnit() != eCSSUnit_Null) {
   10761           1 :       aPropertiesOverridden.AddProperty(prop);
   10762             :     }
   10763           1 :   }
   10764           1 : }
